Subject: [sfraves] NRR: BART Bitch session (missed human connections)

------=_NextPart_000_001A_01C42F1E.A85CE0C0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Ok, I cannot be the only one who has had the typical late night BART =
problem.=20

Why do the damn trains not run later than 12:15 or so?=20

I met a BART employee once, and I asked him about it, but he said "We =
have the safest trains in the country because we shut them down every =
night in order to run a thorough check on the system."=20

OK, that is fine, but what if you are having a fantastic time in the =
city with a friend and you meet someone else through this friend and you =
seem to have a lot in common. In my case, this was a younger person, who =
is also a former chef, which I admire. I would have enjoyed talking =
about the profession.

We were picking him up at the BART station. He saw my friend's car from =
the street (I was in the back seat). He looked lost to me, so I got out, =
smiled and shook his hand, and said, "you look like a raver to me." =
(Which he denied!) Nevertheless, because I had my own train to catch =
(the last one out of Powell), there was not time to connect. (Even with =
cooking in common)=20

I know that Osby has dealt with the BART problem by being =
spontaneous--staying in the city and squeaking by (perhaps sleeping over =
at a friend's house).=20

OK, I want some advice. Do you be responsible, worry about getting back =
to the car (wherever it is BART-parked), or do you just go with the =
flow? I am tired of being responsible when it comes to adventures in the =
City, because my time here is limited.=20

Please tell me your BART STORIES, off list or on list.=20

How did you make the human connection instead of worrying about the =
train connection? Did you take a cab? Did you sleep over?

Now I know why I perpetually drive the car over the bridge like Marin =
county trendsetters who are North Beach "wannabes."

Greg VP

------=_NextPart_000_001A_01C42F1E.A85CE0C0--

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: BART Bitch session (missed human connections)

a couple of years ago me and marty and bekki went to see The Green Mile 
at the Metreon Theater downtown.  we all lived at the EBF house at the 
time, and none of us had running cars at the time, so we walked to 
rockridge bart and caught the 9:20 show.

the movie blew me away, and i had no idea it was a stephen king story 
until the movie was over.  but what almost screwed us was the fact the 
movie is 3 hours long.  so we're all blown away by the movie, or at 
least i was, and you know how you want to take a few minutes to reflect 
on a good movie, go to the bathroom, maybe think about getting 
something to eat after?  nope!  can't do any of that, because we have 
to run, and i mean run, to catch the last train.  the cab ride back 
would have been like $30 or the other option is to wait at the bus 
terminal for the hourly bus.

i've found bart to generally not have enough service to fit my needs 
unless i time it just right and i think it's really a bummer that it 
doesn't run 24 hours.

Subject: [sfraves] How Weird Street Faire TODAY (Sat May 1)

This is always a whole lot of fun. Good weather for it
too! -Sean

> Come ONE... Come ALL...
>
> The San Francisco weather forecast for Saturday is sunny and hot,
> with a high in the mid-80s. Come beat the heat it the most
> creative style -- by being yourself dressed as you favorite
> persona -- as part of our onetime yearly event celebrating all
> things weird!
>
> On May 1st Howard Street will once again become "How Weird" with 4
> City blocks filled with music and dancing, crafts and art,
> performers and merriment.
>
>   The 5th Annual How Weird Street Faire
>   Saturday, May 1st, 2004
>   1pm - 9pm
>   Location: 12th and Howard Streets through the SOMA District
>   Admission: Recommended Donation: $5 (or $3 wearing a weird
>   costume)
>   Latest information: http://www.howweird.org
>
> <><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><>
>
> Things are shaping up for the weeeeeeirdest of all San Francisco
> street faires -- with only a few days to go! Hope everyone has
> their costume sorted out. Please help us out by SPREADING THE
> WORD....
>
> Thanks so much for all the folks who've said they wanted to
> perform at the Faire. The stages are pretty much set.... you're
> always welcome to come and do your own thing in the street. The
> line up has been posted at http:///www.howweird.org
>
> This is a day you don't want to miss. A party where there will be
> lots of people you know and a place for you and your friends to
> dance and meander in the sunny streets and celebrate being in the
> beautiful Bay Area. Like last years there will be bumpin beats
> from Bay Area music collectives -  Tantra, Laird and Lush Camp,
> Adam Ohana and the Space Cowboys on the Unimog and East Bay
> collective Skills Productions.  And of course art and vending and
> food and gardens in the streets. And new this year is a beer
> garden and a PERFORMAnCE stage for bands and weird acts.
>
> I hope you are as excited as I am!
>
> Santosh

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: BART Bitch session (missed human connections)

On Saturday, May 1, 2004, at 01:50  AM, Greg Van Pelt wrote (in part):

> Why do the damn trains not run later than 12:15 or so?
>
> I met a BART employee once, and I asked him about it, but he said "We 
> have the safest trains in the country because we shut them down every 
> night in order to run a thorough check on the system."

	Ha! That's one way to make your trains safer -- just use them less. 
Flippin' bureaucrats. If I could magically step into that situation 
right now and rewind the conversation, it might go something like 
this...

Me - How come you stop running the trains at 12:15 or so?
BART Employee -  We have the safest trains in the country because we 
shut them down every night in order to run a thorough check on the 
system.
Me - Oh, right, of course. Hey, do you ever drink coffee in the morning?
BART Employee - Sure.
Me - Then you should get it at our cafe so you don't risk burning 
yourself. We have the safest coffee in town because we never serve a 
cup without letting it cool to room temperature first. I'm sure you'll 
love it! Have a safe but mediocre day!

Groove on,
				<<< Starchild >>>

Subject: [sfraves] .: Dirtbox Radio 5/2 :. Return to Beat Street!


Word up homie G's

We have a special presentation for you this weekend, brought to you by
Dirtbox Radio and Hypnotik Logik....

RETURN TO BEAT STREET.  read on...

Switchstance vs. Joe Kopasek...Yes, you heard me right.  For one night
only, the best breaks dj in dc and the best breaks dj in baltimore are
going head to head in a 2 hour royal rumble.  These two heavyweights are
going to battle it out to put an end to to the great dc vs. bmore debate.
Both of these breaks veterans come correct every single time out, and have
never left a fan dissapointed, in fact the only thing they leave people is
wanting more. and more. and more.  This is something that if you miss, you
will be shooting yourself in the head every day for the rest of your life.
Who knows if this is something that will ever happen again, so I think
that's your cue to listen in and hear 2 hours of slammin funky evil bangin
breakbeat madness.

Sinestro...What's a party without the living embodiment of the Commodore
64?  Chris is one of the most respected djs in the history of dc dance
music, and was been doing this before most of you knew what a rave was.
On this evening, The mighty sinestro has a treat for you all.  Sunday
night you will get the pleasure of hearing the funk.  And what do i mean
by the funk?  i mean the muthafuckin FUNK.  I'm talkin 90 minutes of
tribute to james brown style funky ass breaks.  How can anyone go wrong
with that? Be Prepared to take a trip back to a time when the breakbeat
was funky and the people danced.

Jesse Tittsworth...Anyone who has heard Jesse Tittsworth most definitely
knows the man's skills.  People who has heard his Krunk 001 mix know that
he can play the funky ghettoness better then almost anyone around here.
What would be a Dirtbox Radio without a little ghetto?  So for this night,
Senor Titts has graciously agreed to drop a set of Bmore Club/Breaks/Miami
Bass/Booty House/Etc to get the night started out propper.  Not many in
the DC/Bmore scene can touch this fool when he's behind the decks, and
you're about to find out why.  If you have not heard Krunk 001, get out
there and get yourself one, and be ready for some real ghetto shit!

So werd, it's something different, and something good.  Very good.
Timeslots and links follow...

07-08:30pm EST - Jesse Tittsworth
08:30-10pm EST - Sinestro
10-12am EST - Switchstance vs Joe Kopasek

Destroyer.net (128k): http://64.246.60.15:8800/listen.pls

Jungletrain.net (64k): http://jungletrain.net/64kbps.pls
Jungletrain.net (24k): http://jungletrain.net/24kbps.pls

Chatroom: http://jungletrain.net/index.php?page=2&subpage=0&color=2
 IRC - irc.jungletrain.net #jungletrain

Webcam: http://glue.umd.edu/~odjallen/dirtboxradio/webcam.html

AIM: dirtboxradio

Big fuckin ups to Ian of Hypnotik Logik for hookin the lineup up.  Dude's
got a great ear for talent, and his bullshit-fu is stronger than most.
Good night of beatz, so tune the fuck in!

EZ!

Jackson aka ODJ

Partners in Crime, www.DirtboxRadio.com, Trividual Productions, ALIAS

---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Date: Sun, 2 May 2004 04:57:21 -0700
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="----=_NextPart_000_0032_01C43001.F3F77D40"
X-Priority: 3
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 6.00.2800.1106
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2800.1106
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] SRR: East Bay evening: Genre contrast (Hispanic house vs. Goth and soccer lessons)

------=_NextPart_000_0032_01C43001.F3F77D40
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Wow, I had an interesting night in the East Bay. I feel like a club kid =
and a future soccer star. (Watch out Beckham)

I did not feel like going too far from home, so I headed over to Hayward =
for some dancing.

The Turf Club, a popular gay bar, had some Hispanic house music being =
played by DJ Kelley, and I found my hip-shaking movement with this =
genre.=20

I have tried Hispanic music before, at the Bench n Bar in Oakland for =
Latin cowboy night, but it amazes me how much beat one can find in the =
"Latin explosion."

But after a few salsa songs, I was ready for something else, so I =
crossed the street to another bar on the "Hayward strip" (downtown =
area).

Little did I know that it was "Goth" night at Club Rumor, and I was =
suprised by how hard I could dance to the Industrial sound.  Also, I was =
astonished to see many gothic girls, getting down to the music, and I =
just joined right in with the hard-ass music (swaying my hips and =
kicking around). Where did I leave that dark lipstick? Osrick, where are =
you?

Man oh man, it was so much fun that I smiled, as usual. (Something you =
are not supposed to do to Industrial music).

But the crowd did not seem to mind, they could tell I was having fun, =
and I met the female DJ afterwards. She was taller than me! Imagine a 6 =
foot 2 female gothic DJ with tattoos! =20

On top of all of that fun, I met a Hispanic guy at the Goth party, and =
we had a long talk about football (that is, soccer). Now that is really =
crossing genres!

He told me the secret to having "power" in the game. It's all in the =
back of the leg, so I think dancers surely have an unknown edge in this =
sport. I am ready to learn more.  I see a bunch of guys in my =
neighborhood playing all of the time, and it looks like something I can =
do. Maybe I missed my calling, because I certainly have powerful legs.

Sincerely,
Greg VP


 
------=_NextPart_000_0032_01C43001.F3F77D40--

Subject: [sfraves] Weekend Review....

OK.. so Saturday night... went 2 this really Awesome Underground... I mean.. it was a Groovy party although we didn't stay long... but i mean... there were alota famil faces there & it was fun catching up w/ alota people... music was Groovy.. we were only there like 1 set & I'm sure the music was good the whole night if we stayed longer.. but ya know.. i been like havin' these mondo like strong ass psychic intuition flashes lately & like i dunno... something totally said that it wasn't right bein' there last night despite how Groovy things were & stuff... but I dunno man... things happened the week priror 2 that night & I dunno... i felt something totally weird & well.. I"m sorry Dan if I fucked up your night by cutting out from there early...

But then we went over 2 a Cinco Demayo party & yaaaaaaaay.. saw somemore family.. that was Dope!!  When we got there.. Li (DiDi, ummm.... LuLu) was on the decks spinning some Wicked Tech Core Step Bass Acid Funk!!!  LoL.. jk.. but he was spining some Bad Ass Breakbeats & I was hella dnacing during his set & well.. some girl started like feeling on me while we wre dancning.. it was fun!!  LoL

Then some House DJ went on next!!  it was Dope!!

I dunno... this was a good night 4 Family & hangin' out w/ Groovy people =)

Today, Sunday, I went 2 Northbeach w/ my cousin Dhoris & it was Dope... went 2 an alley way art show & saw some good art & expensive jewelry...

Walked around Chinatown & Wow man.. would Love 2 spend the day there again some day soon!!  

OK... well... it was a Groovy weekend!!  I want ice cream now...  HAve a good week! =)

Take Care,

From sfraves-return-112333-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Mon May 03 15:22:10 2004

X-Originating-IP: [67.125.255.38]
X-Originating-Email: [electrofunk138@hotmail.com]

From: "Van Mundegaarde" <electrofunk138@hotmail.com>
To: osby@hellokitty.com, sfraves@hyperreal.org
Bcc: 
Date: Mon, 03 May 2004 08:22:08 -0700
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed
Message-ID: <BAY8-F97125jy9ulhon00005ea9@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 03 May 2004 15:22:08.0735 (UTC) FILETIME=[664036F0:01C43122]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves] Weekend Review (a la Marc(O))....

I'm not sure I ever wrote anything about Thursday night - but it was fucking 
dope. Went to Shadow Lounge and got my fill of breaks for the week. All the 
dj's were pretty on point, and the crowd (as usual) was a happy lot. Can't 
go wrong when it comes to breaks. It was an interesting ride home with Osby 
& Frogger...

My Friday adventures were a bit more insane. Started off by checking out 
"Year Of The Monkey". Let me preface by saying, I'm not a trance fan by any 
atretch (at least not any trance past '99), so this already wasn't my scene. 
A friend from out of town wanted to check it out tho, so we went. There was 
a search at the front door, bad sign number 1, there was no booze but they 
ID'd people, mega-bad sign number 2, there were a ton of YOUNG ass females 
and older guys -and the obligatory cyber-raver looking kids - definitely not 
my crowd. The 1st DJ I got to hear was banging out some decent acid-techno - 
but he was quickly replaced by some kid who was spewing epic-y trance, 
complete with lofty arpeggiated synths galore. *VOMIT*

It was time to leave. So we rolled over to Butter for a few VERY nice 
cocktails (in glass glasses I might add!) and some tasty deep/funky house. A 
nice crowd, but nowhere to dance or sit really. So after a few cocktails we 
rolled back to my boys hotel to situate ourselves. After much research, we 
decided to head over to Club Six for the East Coast Boogiemen.

We got there pretty late, and whoever was on right before ECB was tearing up 
the decks. I had yet to get to an actual San Fran house party (yes, I know - 
sue me), and I was not disappointed in the slightest. Now I know where all 
the good dancers are!!! We missed last call by about 5 mintues which kind of 
sucked, but we still managed to have a decent time despite being dry. I ran 
into Apollo and Michael (is that right Apollo?) which was pretty nifty. My 
only disappointment of the night was that both of ECB weren't there. It was 
just Kenny rocking the decks. I was hoping to see Juan there as well since I 
know him a little bit better than Kenny, and haven't seen him in a long 
time. either way - Ken layed down some tasty as beats.

Club Six gets a big thumbs up - great house music, great dancers, sexy crowd 
(my LORD there were some beautiful women there), and decent layout. I wish I 
coulda reviewed the bars too - but there's always next time.

Anyway - that was my weekend.

M-

So like my new piercing is just a normal lobe pierce, but instead of like just getting a stud thingie or a hoop, I got a horseshoe in there & a bead put in the middle so it looks like a hoop, but it isn't...

I kinda felt like wierd @ 1st about putting a horseshoe ear thing a/ a bead in the middle of it on my right ear.. but it totally matches my left ear when i line up the 3 beads on both ears.. it looks pretty Awesome!!! hmmmm... I'll try 2 take pictures & show y'all..

OK.. I just thought I'd share... oh yeah.. so this unofficially makes 19 holes i got, but officially makes only 16 piercings if that makes any sense... LoL

This poem was written by a terminally ill young girl in a New York Hospital.=
=20

It was sent by a   medical doctor - Make sure to read what is in the closing=
 statement AFTER   THE POEM.=20


SLOW DANCE=20

Have you ever watched kids=20

On a merry-go-round?=20

Or listened to the rain=20

Slapping on the ground?=20

Ever followed a butterfly's erratic flight?=20

Or gazed at the sun into the fading night?=20

You better slow down.=20

Don't dance so fast.=20

Time is short.=20

The music won't last.=20

Do you run through each day=20

On the fly?=20

When you ask How are you?   =20

Do you hear the reply?=20

When the day is done=20

Do you lie in your bed=20

With the next hundred chores=20

Running through your head?=20

You'd better slow down=20

Don't dance so fast.=20

Time is short.=20

The music won't last.=20

Ever told your child,   =20

We'll do it tomorrow?=20

And in your haste,=20

Not seen his sorrow?=20

Ever lost touch,=20

Let a good friendship die   =20

Cause you never had time=20

To call and say,"hi"=20

You'd better slow down.=20

Don't dance so fast.=20

Time is short.   =20

The music won't last.=20

When you run so fast to get somewhere   =20

You miss half the fun of getting there.=20

When you worry and hurry through your day,=20

It is like an unopened gift....=20

Thrown away.=20

Life is not a race.=20

Do take it slower=20

Hear the music=20

Before the song is over.=20

PLEASE FORWARD THIS TO HELP THIS LITTLE GIRL.=20

ALL FORWARDED E-MAILS ARE TRACKED TO OBTAIN THE   TOTAL COUNT.=20

Dear All:=20

PLEASE pass this mail on to everybody you know.=20

It is the request of a special little girl who=20

will soon leave this world as she has cancer.=20

Please send this to everyone you know or don't know.=20

This little girl has 6 months left to live, and as her dying wish,=20

She wanted to send a letter telling everyone to live=20

their life to the fullest, since she never will.=20

She'll never make it to prom, graduate from high=20

school, or get married and have a family of her own.=20

By you sending this to as many people as possible,=20

you can give her and her family a little hope,   =20

because with every name that this is sent to,=20

The American Cancer Society=20

will donate 3 cents per name to her treatment and recovery plan.=20

One guy sent this to 500 people! So I know that we can   =20

send it to at least 5 or 6.=20

Just think it could be you one day. It's not even=20

your money, just your time!=20

PLEASE PASS ON AS A LAST REQUEST=20

Dr. Dennis Shields, Professor=20

Department of   Developmental and Molecular Biology=20
1300 Morris Park Avenue =20
Bronx, New York 10461=20

Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

This poem was written by a terminally ill young girl in a New York Hospital.=
=20

It was sent by a   medical doctor - Make sure to read what is in the closing=
 statement AFTER   THE POEM.=20


SLOW DANCE=20

Have you ever watched kids=20

On a merry-go-round?=20

Or listened to the rain=20

Slapping on the ground?=20

Ever followed a butterfly's erratic flight?=20

Or gazed at the sun into the fading night?=20

You better slow down.=20

Don't dance so fast.=20

Time is short.=20

The music won't last.=20

Do you run through each day=20

On the fly?=20

When you ask How are you?   =20

Do you hear the reply?=20

When the day is done=20

Do you lie in your bed=20

With the next hundred chores=20

Running through your head?=20

You'd better slow down=20

Don't dance so fast.=20

Time is short.=20

The music won't last.=20

Ever told your child,   =20

We'll do it tomorrow?=20

And in your haste,=20

Not seen his sorrow?=20

Ever lost touch,=20

Let a good friendship die   =20

Cause you never had time=20

To call and say,"hi"=20

You'd better slow down.=20

Don't dance so fast.=20

Time is short.   =20

The music won't last.=20

When you run so fast to get somewhere   =20

You miss half the fun of getting there.=20

When you worry and hurry through your day,=20

It is like an unopened gift....=20

Thrown away.=20

Life is not a race.=20

Do take it slower=20

Hear the music=20

Before the song is over.=20

PLEASE FORWARD THIS TO HELP THIS LITTLE GIRL.=20

ALL FORWARDED E-MAILS ARE TRACKED TO OBTAIN THE   TOTAL COUNT.=20

Dear All:=20

PLEASE pass this mail on to everybody you know.=20

It is the request of a special little girl who=20

will soon leave this world as she has cancer.=20

Please send this to everyone you know or don't know.=20

This little girl has 6 months left to live, and as her dying wish,=20

She wanted to send a letter telling everyone to live=20

their life to the fullest, since she never will.=20

She'll never make it to prom, graduate from high=20

school, or get married and have a family of her own.=20

By you sending this to as many people as possible,=20

you can give her and her family a little hope,   =20

because with every name that this is sent to,=20

The American Cancer Society=20

will donate 3 cents per name to her treatment and recovery plan.=20

One guy sent this to 500 people! So I know that we can   =20

send it to at least 5 or 6.=20

Just think it could be you one day. It's not even=20

your money, just your time!=20

PLEASE PASS ON AS A LAST REQUEST=20

Dr. Dennis Shields, Professor=20

Department of   Developmental and Molecular Biology=20
1300 Morris Park Avenue =20
Bronx, New York 10461=20

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  The Full Moon of Wesak, this Wednesday.

--=====================_14293673==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

The Full Moon of Wesak, this Wednesday.

During this special time of the Full Moon of Wesak, it is as if a door is 
suddenly opened wide, which at other times is more closed. Through this 
door, it is possible to contact energies which are otherwise not easily 
available.  Great expansions of consciousness become possible which are not 
possible at other times.  People, such as yourself, who are on a spiritual 
path, can find great aid and spiritual stimulation at this time to take 
great steps forward.

It is said that Buddha descends from His high place during the full moon of 
Taurus*, the Wesak Festival of Light, to bestow spiritual blessings on the 
world.  He joins with the World Teacher of Love, and together they transmit 
two spiritual streams of energy - Divine Love and Divine Light.  Buddha's 
task in returning for this brief time of the Wesak Festival is to remind us 
of the possibility of illumination, keeping a channel open for light to 
illuminate the minds of humanity.

At this time of the Full Moon of Wesak, contact can be made with greater 
Lives, called the "Great Ones," Who are to the Masters what the Masters are 
to humanity.  Part of the purpose of Buddha's appearance is to embody the 
force which can stimulate people everywhere to come together as a group, 
with a focused intent, and thus reach symbolically "the ear and the heart" 
of the Great Ones.

http://www.orindaben.com/home/festlight.htm

There will be many outdoor celebrations in the Bay Area, including some 
Full Moon gatherings.

Love,

Apollo



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

--=====================_14293673==.ALT--

At 08:22 AM 5/3/2004, Van Mundegaarde wrote:
>  After much research, we decided to head over to Club Six for the East 
> Coast Boogiemen.
>
>We got there pretty late, and whoever was on right before ECB was tearing 
>up the decks. I had yet to get to an actual San Fran house party (yes, I 
>know - sue me), and I was not disappointed in the slightest. Now I know 
>where all the good dancers are!!! We missed last call by about 5 mintues 
>which kind of sucked, but we still managed to have a decent time despite 
>being dry. I ran into Apollo and Michael (is that right Apollo?) which was 
>pretty nifty.

Good seeing you there too, Marc O.  The guy I introduced you to was Joey, 
my partner.  Andrew Phelan was also at Club 6 that night as well as quite a 
few hard core househeads I know.  Yep, lots of moving funky house that 
night -- my ass is wed to the funk these days:)


>Club Six gets a big thumbs up - great house music, great dancers, sexy 
>crowd (my LORD there were some beautiful women there), and decent layout. 
>I wish I coulda reviewed the bars too - but there's always next time.

6 is one of the very few clubs I'll attend these days.  Friendly security 
(just an ID check at the door) with a vibe that one used to find at many 
venues in town.  Get to know the bartenders and one need only buy a couple 
of drinks -- very stiff.  And, it's true, folks really dance at Club 
6.  Usually have breakers in the back.  It's all there:  sex, good music....

Last week I went to a soul clash party there.  I've also attended some 
great hip hop events, along with world music, techno and just about every 
other genre.  If I go there without knowing what's going down that night 
I'm never disappointed.

Next Saturday is "Atmosphere" at 6:  deep house, with Matty Heilbronn, 
Mauricio Aviles and Rasaki Aladokun performing live 
(percussionist).  Looking forward to it.

Love,

Apollo



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: The opposite of success (will the ecomony improve?)

------=_NextPart_000_0023_01C43160.AA221BC0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi all in SFR land,=20

I wanted to share a personal perspective about the feelings that one has =
when competitive economic conditions (jobs and interviews) lead to =
negative feelings of self-doubt.=20

How do you overcome the obstacles in boom-to-bust cycles concerning =
career choices?=20

I moved here in 2000 for a dot-com job (like many people), and when =
things went bad and our technical writing department was Riffed (reduced =
in force), I found another job at a huge salary reduction (about 20%).=20

Then I got frustrated with management incompetence at my new job =
(although I lasted a year), and I resigned voluntarily.=20

I am having trouble finding another job and I think the economy is not =
recovering here so I am leaving.=20

I feel like I failed because I literally poured my heart and soul into =
the new job search. I wrote two technical white papers on my own time =
and submitted them as writing samples to prospective employers.=20

In many interviews, no one bothered to comment on something that I know =
was a valid example of my talent (and I am not trying to boast here).=20

Anyway, I hope that I can reinvent myself, move on as I planned to do, =
and write about other topics (other than the technology field).=20

The wheels are still in motion regarding traveling the nation, and I =
will write more about this later, like a junior John Steinbeck. Has =
anyone read "The Grapes of Wrath?" It still has relevance for modern =
American society.

Sincerely,=20

Greg VP

------=_NextPart_000_0023_01C43160.AA221BC0--

Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>

Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 98462 invoked from network); 4 May 2004 08:15:32 -0000
Message-ID: <007401c431ad$9738c5c0$d4f70418@attbi.com>
From: "Greg Van Pelt" <gregvp@comcast.net>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Date: Tue, 4 May 2004 00:58:27 -0700
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Priority: 3
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 6.00.2800.1106
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2800.1106
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Trip down memory lane (HRAVEs circa 1999)

It is funny how when you are cleaning up your old email archives you can
start a trip down memory lane. At one time, I subscribed to HRAVES (Houston,
TX). Back in December 1999, I went to a benefit rave called 4 Tha Kidz, and
the benefactor was Toys for Tots.

Picture if you will a whole bunch of Kandy Kids bringing in toys for
charity. It was a blast. The Houston Firemen (our sponsors) loved it. On top
of that, the venue was an old warehouse near Downtown Houston, and that
Saturday night there was a post-election party happening in the same
location. Apparently, a candidate for Houston City Council was hosting her
own party, although she lost the run-off election to another candidate.

They were certainly gawking (AND pointing) at us ravers through large
Plexiglass windows above the dance floor! They acted as if they had never
seen anything so bizarre before! So, I decided to check out the neighbors
and join their celebration two floors above our mighty rave (wanted to show
them a few moves).

I fit right in (was not wearing my candy), and I actually really enjoyed
visiting their party, and after I introduced myself to the candidate, we
talked and danced. Everybody at this party was feeling their own disco vibe
to Sister Sledge (We are Family) and other delights, a great contrast to the
booming rave music nearby.

I guess that the spirit of dance movement can grip you no matter which scene
you are frequenting! I helped them clean up the place since I crashed the
party, ate their nachos, and drank their beer, and I sent a contribution for
the next election (although I was not a constituent).
That's my trip,
Greg VP



---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

sorry to break it to you.... but this is actually a HOAX..... doing a google
search for the doctors name "Dr. Dennis Shields, Professor" would have
resulted in NUMEROUS sites toting that this is a hoax....

always remember -- google is your friend....

http://www.truthorfiction.com/rumors/s/slowdance.htm
http://www.trendmicro.com/vinfo/hoaxes/hoax5.asp?HName=%22Slow+Dance%22+Hoax
http://www.breakthechain.org/exclusives/slowdance.html


----------------------------------------------------------------------------
----------
Rule of thumb: Any e-mail message that starts out by telling you that it
isn't a chain letter most likely is! This one's been around in one form or
another since 1997, creating an interesting snapshot of the life of a hoax.
In its original form, it told the story of Jessica Mydeck, who supposedly
had a terrible form of brain cancer. Since the letter claimed she only has 6
months to live, her name was probably removed from future texts to keep it
from being identified as outdated (or as the hoax it is).






The poem was written by David L. Weatherford and published in 1991 by the
Russ Berrie Company. It was added to the chain letter in early 2001.
Wetherford is uncertain how the poem came to be associated with the dying
child hoax and does not endorse its inclusion. Heartwarming and
inspirational, it lowers our defenses and make us less skeptical of the rest
of the message. Other versions of this "dying kid" chain letter feature an
ASCII-Text "Elmo" or other feel-good messages instead of the poem.

Dr. Shields' involvement with this letter is a case of False Attribution
Syndrome. He has nothing to do with this hoax other than the fact that he
forwarded the message and automatically attached his "signature" to it. In a
2001 statement on their website, the Albert Einstein College of Medicine
denied Dr. Shields' involvement with the hoax and asked you to delete it and
help stop its spread.

The message implies that the American Cancer Society is tracking forwards of
the message, but the ACS denies any involvement with this or any other
e-mail scheme to provide help to a needy child. Besides, E-mail tracking as
it is described in the letter is technologically impossible.

Most of us would love to help the fight against cancer, especially if it
were as easy of forwarding an e-mail message. Bottom line, the fight for
cancer takes money. The American Cancer Society doesn't make donations, they
collect them - your donations and mine. Hoaxes like this one hurt
organizations like ACS because they force them to divert valuable time,
personnel, and resources to respond to the lies. Break this Chain!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
----------

"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

Thread-Index: AcQyY4sHADedxxz8TsiKZtlTbq65BA==
Message-Id: <E1BLF9q-0003fO-00@goose.mail.pas.earthlink.net>
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR - max needs positive energy

Hey everybody,

I've been a long time lurker on SF Raves going way back to 1993 and I need
some positive energy sent my way. My cat Max has gastro-intestinal lymphoma
and is on the last of his nine lives. He started getting sick last November.
He was vomiting and loosing a lot of weight. He was down from 15lbs to 8lbs
in weight. His regular vet wasn't sure what was wrong with him and we tried
a whole bunch of things trying to rule out everything but cancer. Max was
eventually referred to a specialist veterinary clinic where they did an
ultrasound that showed a mass in his tummy and then did an endoscopy that
confirmed that he has lymphoma. He immediately started chemotherapy (which
can be pretty successful in cats) and was put into clinical remission after
three sessions. Before he could start his fourth chemo treatment his heart
started giving his trouble and his lungs were filling with fluid and he had
to go to the 24hr emergency clinic in the middle of the night on St
Patrick's day. The vets gave him medicine to help with his heart trouble and
decided that he probably only has another month to live with his heart
condition. Much to everyone's surprise, max really rebounded and did really
well, eating a lot and gaining 2lbs and seemed like he was back to his old
self (he even caught a mouse!). The vet was really surprised that he was
doing so well and put him back on a less aggressive chemo protocol while
they monitored his heart condition. Two weeks ago max started to vomit again
and loose his appetite. He went to the vet on Monday and got another dose of
a fairly powerful chemotherapy drug. He is still vomiting and not eating and
the vet said that if he doesn't show any signs of getting better by the
weekend I should probably consider having him euthanized so that he wont
suffer anymore.
I've had max since he was only eight weeks old. He has been a real source of
comfort to me over the past thirteen years and I can't imagine him not being
there anymore.
So if everybody could send max some positive energy to help him beat this we
would really be grateful


You can see Max at http://home.earthlink.net/~max_the_cat/cats.html


~Sean and Max








******************************************

Stereo Jack:=20

born 1969 in hamburg/germany=20

finished school in 1986=20

studied trading from 1986 thru 1989=20

worked as a dj since 1987,playing:=20
*house*technohouse*acidhouse=20

first release in 1990 on container records/hamburg as a=20
member of =E2=80=9Cvdt-vorsprung durch techno=E2=80=9D=20
(for all other releases see discographie)=20

several dj-residencies in the following clubs/raves from=20
1987 thru 1999:=20
*base/kiel *agent orange/hamburg * giganten/hamburg=20
*front club/hamburg *club amphore/hamburg *tollhouse=20
and sundance/hamburg *object/dresden *unit/hamburg=20

dj appearances in the following clubs(just to name a few):=20
*ultraschall/munich *u-club/wuppertal *lait solaire/leipzig=20
*octan/bautzen *phonodrome/hamburg *ostgut/berlin=20
*tresor/berlin *so 36/berlin *participant of the =E2=80=9Cno=20
historical backspin=E2=80=9D-movement=20

producing popmusic since 1994 as well as underground=20
stuff. several releases and remixes. most successful pop-=20
projects are =E2=80=9Ctank=E2=80=9D and =E2=80=9Cn.y.c.c.=E2=80=9D.=20

running or participating in the following underground=20
projects: *stereo jack *vdt *stereo & flash *toffeemaker=20
*stereo jack & doorkeeper *stereo & r2 *keep it=20
stereo *mono meltdown *s-a-s *r.a.m. =E2=80=93 rapid ass=20
movement.=20

producing together with or for: *johnny flash *holgi star *joe & jessey=20
*romanto *pet duo/brazil=20

Subject: [sfraves] OK... Hello 2DAy... So damn trippy... MegaTron, DJM, BAM...

OK.. so my day was spent like well.. doin' homework, although, i did procrastinate a lil here & there 'cause i pretended i was a model walking on the catwalk in my house or like i was pretending I was on stage singing w/ *NSYNC! LoL... OK.. yeah.. unfortunately i didn't go 2 school early 2 take some tests like i was planning on & i ended havin' this mondo caffine fixation & ordered a pizza just so they could send me a 2 Litter Coke w/ it.. LoL

Anywaze, got 2 school evening time, took a test, had a mondo bitching session w/ some calssmates about how the teachers teaching methods fuckn' suck.. la la la... didn't feel like staying 4 the rest of class since all we were gonna do was like review 4 the final next week, so i left early 'cause i was feeling kinda uuugghhh 'cause i so hate math!

walked around the City & well.. for a while, i went 2 those intercom dial boxes on like those apt building & called a few residents on those intercom thingie & waited 4 the VM 2 kick in left messages...

So after that, walked around the city more pretending i was a model on the catwalk again when i was walkin' up 3rd 'cause I was listening 2 m y walkman & stuff... them somehow i like totally ended up hangin' out w/ BAM & DJM.. LoL. .it was fun!!  Ya know, I've noticed in the past few weeks i been hangin' out w/ Bam.. there's been sooo much 2 talk about w/ him!!  Oh yeah... he's also a good listener if u ever have a need 2 talk about like anything... it was also Dope
kicki' it w/ DJM 'cause LoL... well... he always has like these mondo random things he says that are just heeeeeeeella funny! I Love it!  Oh yeah... I was entrusted TOOP SECRET info when i was w/ them.. so shhhhh... GROOVE IS IN THE HEART YE YE YE YEAAAAH!

After hangin out like 4 almost 2 hours, I caught bart & started like flirting w/ this art student girl who i met on bart & commenting on her purse... OK.. Hello 2Day.. after the next stop like took off, I sawt his familiar dude like walkin up the isle w/ a bag of records.. Oh Shit!!!

"MEGA" I yelled outta like frustration 'cause i almost 4got what his name was as the train started moving and making sounds.  No response!


"YO MEGATRON!!!" I yelled even louder!  He turned around w/ this surprising look on his face.  I like totally ran up, accidentally threw my backpack on someone's
lap & I hugged Mr Mega!! LoL

It was Dope.. we rode the whole way 2 El Cerrito Del Norte stop & mondo caught up on like eeeeeeeeverything!!!  It was Sooooooo So Dope shillin' w/ Mega again after heeeeeeeella long man.. LoL... oh yeah... he also entrusted me w/ some like TOP SECRET INFO.. shhhhhhhhh... =)

So I dunno... my night was kinda like totally unexpected, mondo surprising, & damn.. so fun!  LoL.. Hello 2day... Wow.. I'm buggin'!!

OK.. again.. just thought i'd share, but yeah, so a Jungle DJ is like alwasy in the City somewhere 2 hang out w/ & Breakbeats DJ is always a Groovy person 2 talk 2 is the morale of this story I guess =)  Well.. also.. there's gonna be alot Groovy stuff goin on this Summer from the way things are lookin'... =)


Take Care,

Subject: [sfraves]  NRR - max needs positive energy

 

 
 Hey Aaron,

It wasn't my intention to solicit donations but thanks for the addition to
his fund. I'm already over $4000 in the hole with vet expenses and I also
just lost my job so your donation is greatly appreciated.

Thanks for all the positive thoughts and energy
 
 Sean and Max
 
 



> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Aaron W [mailto:aaron@agentrecords.com]
> > Sent: Wednesday, May 05, 2004 12:12 AM
> > To: 'Freak Zone!'
> > Subject: RE: [sfraves] NRR - max needs positive energy
> > 
> > Tell Max I send my good wishes, and pet him between the ears for me.
> > 
> > I put $5 in your paypal fund for him.
> > 
> > Cats are rad,
> > Aaron
> > 
> > 
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Freak Zone! [mailto:freakzone@mindspring.com]
> > Sent: Tuesday, May 04, 2004 10:41 PM
> > To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
> > Subject: [sfraves] NRR - max needs positive energy
> > 
> > Hey everybody,
> > 
> > I've been a long time lurker on SF Raves going way back to
> > 1993 and I need some positive energy sent my way. My cat Max has 
> > gastro-intestinal lymphoma and is on the last of his nine lives. He 
> > started getting sick last November.
> > He was vomiting and loosing a lot of weight. He was down 
> from 15lbs to 
> > 8lbs in weight. His regular vet wasn't sure what was wrong with him 
> > and we tried a whole bunch of things trying to rule out 
> everything but 
> > cancer. Max was eventually referred to a specialist 
> veterinary clinic 
> > where they did an ultrasound that showed a mass in his 
> tummy and then 
> > did an endoscopy that confirmed that he has lymphoma. He 
> immediately 
> > started chemotherapy (which can be pretty successful in 
> cats) and was 
> > put into clinical remission after three sessions.
> > Before he could start his fourth chemo treatment his heart started 
> > giving his trouble and his lungs were filling with fluid 
> and he had to 
> > go to the 24hr emergency clinic in the middle of the night on St 
> > Patrick's day. The vets gave him medicine to help with his heart 
> > trouble and decided that he probably only has another month to live 
> > with his heart condition. Much to everyone's surprise, max really 
> > rebounded and did really well, eating a lot and gaining 2lbs and 
> > seemed like he was back to his old self (he even caught a mouse!).
> > The vet was really surprised that he was doing so well and put him 
> > back on a less aggressive chemo protocol while they monitored his 
> > heart condition. Two weeks ago max started to vomit again and loose 
> > his appetite. He went to the vet on Monday and got another 
> dose of a 
> > fairly powerful chemotherapy drug. He is still vomiting and 
> not eating 
> > and the vet said that if he doesn't show any signs of 
> getting better 
> > by the weekend I should probably consider having him euthanized so 
> > that he wont suffer anymore.
> > I've had max since he was only eight weeks old. He has been a real 
> > source of comfort to me over the past thirteen years and I can't 
> > imagine him not being there anymore.
> > So if everybody could send max some positive energy to help 
> him beat 
> > this we would really be grateful
> > 
> > 
> > You can see Max at http://home.earthlink.net/~max_the_cat/cats.html
> > 
> > 
> > ~Sean and Max
> > 
> >

Subject: [sfraves]  NRR - Wanna live in the Haight?

If interested, reply to me directly.

Thanks,
Tim

Due to a roommate leaving for another country in June,
we have an extra room that will be available for rent
come in the middle of June. It's the biggest room in
the flat and it's on the top floor. You will be
sharing the place with three students all in their mid
to later twenties who are all in school for teaching
related stuff and two cats that run up and down the
halls. We are fairly quiet and respectful to others
and it's on Ashbury Street, right in between Haight
and Waller. We have our own washer and dryer in the
utility closet(no more quarters to do your laundry
down the street), DirectTV, a small but cool living
room, DSL and yeah, I'm sure there are other cool
things about the house, but I can't think of them
right now.....sorry. The room will be open on June 15
and we want this filled ASAP. If interested, send us
an email and we will get back in touch.

Subject: RE: [sfraves] BSP attempt 2: [modified] free party - tonite!

the kind reviews are much appreciated! - i had a great time as well and
would definitely say that party ranks in the top 5 of parties ive ever had
the chance to throw :)  i havent seen a crowd bounce that hard for that long
in quite awhile.  parties like that remind me why i ever got into the whole
promoting mess to begin.

modified has been quietly throwing these types of events for sometime now,
and while the sudden hype is exciting im begging everyone to "keep it real"
and help us to continue to be able to make things like saturday nite happen.

many thanks to kent, shonn, tala and mike for all your relentless help. good
parties dont happen without help from friends like you guys!

watch out a series of free *sunrise* events at virgin locations coming this
summer!  ive also got all sorts of other plans/ideas for other shows in the
works so keep your eyes open.

element
http://www.modifedproductions.com

"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

OK... so a few months ago... while Deepfog & GTI Fog were visiting me, Deep asked me if i wanted 2 take over the QOTD posts since he was gonna stop doing it on SFR after how many years, ya know.... & @ the time i said, "Well, I'll probably wait a while 'til i get really inspired to do make a really Dope QOTD post" la la la la... I mean... Deep already gave me the keys & codes 2 years ago & stuff, so like I dunno... this was alota pressure @ the time...

So anywaze... I figure now is the time I guess & I hope 2 do a good job or whatever doin' this & in the fashion that Deep has done it, & I ain't even sure about doin' it daily... but 2 start things off, I figure i gotta be @least kinda mushy w/ my ever very 1st QOTD...

---------------------------------->

So I was watching Laverne & Shirley during a study break earlier 2day... there were these gang girlies in this episode & Shirley made this speech 2 them in hopes that they would learn the rights & wrongs of t=what they do la la la...

after the speech, these 2 girls went back 2 thier apt telling them they left the gang...

Gangster Girlie1 said, "I don't have any friends anymore," as she looked @ Gangster Girlie2.

Laverne said, "Well, you still got her, and 1 friend is all you need! Right Shirl?" 

Then they all smiled & laughed @ each other & show ended!

---------------------------------->

OK.. how was that?  Did i do a good job Deep?  Oh hey... I'm sorry i didn't call u back the other night, but like U remember how confussed I was about things that evening & well.. when i was gonna call u back.. i figured it was like kinda late in our timezone already...  {{{HUGZ}}}

OK... la la la

OK, I am really leaving soon, because I have to vacate my house by May =
17 (more on that later).=20

In the meantime, what is the best way to tell the world (or sfraves) =
what is happening in your region?=20

I have never done the BLOG trick, even after it became the media darling =
(articles in Newsweek and such), but is it effective?=20

As a writer, I worry about information theft (much like Corporate =
America). What if someone steals your ideas based on your web log?=20

Does the copyright mean anything today?=20

I am just wondering about the whole concept of opening up on the =
Internet, something that is not exactly revolutionary anymore.=20

Thanks,=20

Greg VP

Subject: [sfraves] ATP: BSP: This Sunday Catch Jack Triumph's New Show on KUSF 90.3 FM

------=_NextPart_000_0035_01C43343.8299F610
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Farms in Berkeley?!? No something much better. While it is a bit =
premature, I will be out of town this weekend at:
http://www.avbc.com/news/boontbeerfest.html ... and wanted to let you =
all know of something absolutely amazing that has found its way into my =
neck of the woods. I'll try and keep it short and sweet.

It appears my sets on ThumpRadio went well and was warmly received. I =
was contacted earlier in the week and provided the opportunity to begin =
my own radio show, through ThumpRadio, on San Francisco's own KUSF 90.3 =
FM.=20

Every 2nd Sunday, from 8 - Midnight, you can catch the best progressive =
music in the scene, locally and from around the world. In addition to =
myself getting to expose you all to some bangin' Proggy beats, I will be =
featuring a local guest DJ, or maybe not local ;), for a special =
appearance. This Sunday, if I can manage to get a hold of him, I will be =
featuring Jason Lee. In addition to being a progression resident, Jason =
has been laying down slab's of vinyl since I got out of diapers. =
Seriously this guy has been playing longer than most politicians =
careers. He sets are technically amazing, and always featuring the =
newest, coolest choons that have managed to make there way into his =
crates, before I even knew it was released.=20

So, with there being no time like the present, catch me this Sunday on =
90.3 FM, starting at 8 pm. If you, or someone you know outside of the =
area wants to tune in, you can stream it here:
http://kusf.org/index.shtml
Click on "Listen Now"

Wish me luck!
--

Date: Thu, 06 May 2004 14:46:44 -0700
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="=====================_599875==.ALT"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Rhythm Science

--=====================_599875==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

DJ Spooky's first book.  Looks interesting:

Rhythm Science
Paul D. Miller
a.k.a. Dj Spooky that Subliminal Kid

"Miller's insights as a practicing and successful DJ are fresh and 
unpretentious." -Publishers Weekly
In his first book, conceptual artist Paul D. Miller, also known as Dj 
Spooky that Subliminal Kid, delivers a manifesto for rhythm science-the 
creation of art from the flow of patterns in sound and culture, "the 
changing same."  His template is the DJ's mix, spun from the ideas, images, 
and sounds that bombard daily us and refashioned into something new, 
expressive, and endlessly variable. Technology provides the method as well 
as the medium, bridging the artist's consciousness and the outside world.

Miller constructed his Dj Spooky persona ("spooky" from the eerie sounds of 
hip-hop, techno, ambient, and the other music that he plays) as a 
conceptual art project, but then came to see it as an opportunity for 
broader experiments.  For example: "Start with the inspiration of George 
Herriman's Krazy Kat comic strip. Make a track invoking his absurd 
landscapes. . .What do tons and tons of air pressure moving in the 
atmosphere sound like?  Make music that acts a metaphor for that kind of 
immersion or density." Or, for an online "remix" of two works by Marcel 
Duchamp: "I took a lot of his material written on music and flipped it into 
a DJ mix of his visual material-with him rhyming!"

Tracing the genealogy of rhythm science, Miller cites sources and 
influences as varied as Ralph Waldo Emerson ("all minds quote"), 
Grandmaster Flash, W. E. B. Dubois, James Joyce, and Eminem.  "The story 
unfolds while the fragments coalesce," he writes.  A heady mix of 
autobiography and theory, Rhythm Science melds words, images, and sounds 
(on an included audio CD) to demonstrate how conceptual art, popular 
culture, and idealism can activate one another in this era of multiplex 
consciousness.
In a review that places Miller in the company of writer/musicians Glenn 
Gould and John Fahey, Publishers Weekly says that Rhythm Science gives DJ 
culture "the broad contextualization its innovations have long
warranted."

Rhythm Science has been designed for maximum visual and tactile seduction 
by the international studio COMA (Cornelia Blatter and Marcel 
Hermans).  The design embodies Miller's method of layering and 
juxtaposition with texts and images that bleed through from page to 
page.  From its velvet flesh cover to the die-cut hole through the center 
of the book, which reveals a colored nub that holds the CD, Rhythm Science 
is an irresistible package, notable for its sensual qualities as well as 
for its intellectual ones.
Paul D. Miller, a.k.a. Dj Spooky that Subliminal Kid, is a conceptual 
artist, writer, and musician living in New York City. His artwork has 
appeared in the Whitney Biennial, the Venice Biennale for Architecture, the 
Andy Warhol Museum, and many other venues. His written work has appeared in 
such publications as the Village Voice and Artforum.  He is an editor of 
the magazine 21c (www.21cmagazine.com).  Renowned for CDs such as Riddim 
Warfare and Optometry, Miller will premiere his multimedia spectacle, Dj 
Spooky's Rebirth of a Nation, this summer at the 2004 Lincoln Center 
Festival, the Spoleto Festival, the Vienna Festival, and the Festival 
d'Automne in Paris.

"We've ended the century of broadcast culture-when manufacturers produced 
the culture we consume.  In this brilliant and beautiful book, Paul Miller 
gives us the rhythm of sampled culture-culture created by those who can 
remix, and by technologies that enable anyone to remix.  Rhythm Science is 
science; it is art; it is the story of how freedom would build better 
science and art.  Dark, with bright flashes, in tempo, with syncopation, it 
is a companion to the next stage, if we're allowed that next stage despite 
law that would keep us locked in the past."
-Lawrence Lessig, Stanford Law School, author of The Future of Ideas: The 
Fate of the Commons in a Connected World

"Once again, Paul Miller has pushed the sonic arts and sciences to a new 
level, and in the process re-
mastered literary form.  I guarantee, this book will mess with your head, 
but in a funky way."
-Robin D. G. Kelley, author of Freedom Dreams: The Black Radical Imagination


Mediawork Pamphlets series

Publication date: April 16, 2004
$17.95 original paperback with audio CD
5 1/2 x 7 1/2 * 130 pages * ISBN 0-262-63287-X


Moksha Tribe: www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101: http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the 
children of humans as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in 
the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure or 
nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Lives based on having are less free than lives based on either doing or on 
being."
-William James

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie






--=====================_599875==.ALT--

To: sfraves@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves] BSP attempt 2: [modified] free party - tonite!

    All I got was a brief email about this party. I had no idea who 
Modified were, nor any of the DJs. It sounded like an outdoor renegade 
which I always have a good time at. Most of my friends turned their 
noses up because they didn't know the promoters, the DJs or anyone else 
going, but 2 of my friends, Chris and Charlie were down to go with me. 
Even though what I saw said the party would start at 11, I knew in my 
raver heart of hearts that that meant later, and that the voicemail 
would not be up with directions when promised. Raver Time is about as 
slow as Colored People Time usually, so I didn't sweat it. When we heard 
the directions, we thought wow, it's near Homebase, but even as we drove 
up to the designated intersection, we still thought it had to be across 
the street or something. When we were told where to go, my heart started 
beating faster in anticipation. See, I had never been to Homebase. That 
is a name that is said with nothing short of reverence when the 
old-skoolers talk about "the way it used to be before it started to suck 
like it does now." We enter the warehouse, which is pitch black and 
people around us are using the displays from their cell phones to 
illuminate their path. We get to the other side of this huge, empty 
space, and the only thing I could hear was the drone of  a generator. We 
climb through a hole in the wall, walk up this hallway towards the 
generator, open a door, and BAM-O!!! Music and writhing bodies. Nothing 
else. Nary a blacklight to be seen. No light at all except for what is 
coming from the dj setup. Just hard, banging music and a packed, packed 
dance floor. Perhaps it was the vibe from yester-year which permeates 
those walls. Perhaps it was the audacity with which someone dared to 
risk revisiting a site that was shut down so long ago. All I know is 
that this is a party that I will remember for a long time. Oh, yeah, 
fyi, I was the guy spinning fire. :-)

Happy

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  Odeed @ Mash-Up / Friday, May 21st

Just a couple weeks away from Evil Breaks second party, Mash-Up.  We're 
especially excited to be bringing up DJ and producer, Odeed.  In addition to 
being a solid breakbeat DJ, hip hop DJ, and producer (with tracks on 
Moonshine Music) he's also a pretty bad ass turntablist!

For some samples of what this guy can do, check out his site here:

http://zebox.com/odeed/music

"coldcuttinfinished" is a short clip showcasing his cuttin' and scratchin' 
skills.  check out a few of his other mixes while you're at it.

--------
Evil Breaks presents....

MASH-UP
Friday, May 21st

Featuring:
Odeed - (Moonshine/LABA/W.E.)

Odeed is simply one of the sickest producers and dj's/turntablists around. 
He has had multiple releases on Moonshine Green with fellow producer Bionic, 
and his style of breaks easily distinguish him from other producers. He's 
had many affiliations including Moonshine, C.T.W., Downtown Dwellars, 2 
Covert Capin's, and of course L.A.B.A. One of his most recent performances 
in the Bay (May, 2003) was at 1015 where he opened up for Uberzone, and we 
are proud to bring him back again for a performance not to be missed.

vs

DJ Wish (W.E. - Baltimore, MD)

Originally hailing from Balmtimore, MD dj Wish has made a name for herself 
with her unique style of breaks. She has had many residencies to include, 
The Edge (DC), Tracks (DC), and The Spot (Baltimore). She has also worked 
closely with Shaken Not Stirred Records, Deep Rising Productions, F(x) 
productions, and she has performed at the world famous Buzz (Nation) in 
Washington DC. Odeed and Wish are currently working on a few tracks 
together, and this event is going to be part of their nation wide tour to 
promote their new label W.E. Recordings. I've been told we might get to hear 
some unreleased tracks that are sure to tear up the dance floor.

Also Performing:


A:Dubl (Breakthru)
Majere (Elektrosorcery) - Special Breaks Set
Aaron Jae vs. Athena (AaronJae.com/Seekr vs. Gravity Crew)
DJ Bam vs. Nick Nyquil (Invibe vs Oneiromancy/Ill Behavior)
M.O.D. (Evil Breaks)


We are having a second room that is going to be hosted by the Ambient Mafia. 
Downtempo beats for you to chill out to. The Ambient Mafia has done chill 
rooms for Moksha Tribe and the upstairs at 550 barnaveld and countless other 
parties that you've probably been to.

Ambient Room:

MC Boomerang
Fidget
Stickyboy
Harken
DJ fieldsoe
Skye
Hallucid

This event will be a small 250 capacity two room and we'll be bangin out the 
Breaks from 9pm till 4 am

Presales: $7
Door: $10

Tickets will be available at Skills, F-8, and Solid Grooves shortly and 
online at:
www.Groovetickets.com

More Information:

408.278.5211
www.EvilBreaks.com

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  DEA Agent Demonstrates Gun Safety to School Kids -- By
  Shooting Himself

--=====================_1061456==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Newsbrief: DEA Agent Demonstrates Gun Safety to School Kids -- By Shooting 
Himself

  5/7/04

Now, here's a lesson on gun safety that will not quickly be forgotten. 
According to Orlando, Florida, television station WKMG, an Orlando-based 
DEA agent shot himself in the leg during a gun safety presentation to local 
kids. The agent, whom superiors mercifully refused to name, was treated at 
the Orlando Hospital Center after the April 9 incident and is now back on 
the job.

According to police reports, the agent drew his .40-caliber pistol and 
removed the magazine, then pulled back the slide and asked someone from the 
audience to look inside the gun and confirm it wasn't loaded. The pistol 
was pointed at the floor, and when he released the slide, one bullet fired 
into the top of his left thigh.

The DEA agent's presentation was at an event sponsored by the Orlando 
Minority Youth Golf Association 
(<http://www.omyga.org>http://www.omyga.org). There was no explanation as 
to the link between teen golf and gun safety.

But the agent's presentation had an impact, according to witnesses. "The 
kids screamed and started to cry," said Vivian Farmer, who attended the 
presentation with her 13-year-old nephew. "Everyone was pretty shaken up," 
Farmer told WKMG. "But the point of gun safety hit home. Unfortunately, the 
agent had to get shot. But after seeing that, my nephew doesn't want to 
have anything to do with guns."

-- END --
http://stopthedrugwar.org/chronicle/336/dea.shtml




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

>be missed.

>closely with Shaken Not Stirred Records, Deep Rising Productions, F(x)

>From: Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org>
>To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  DEA Agent Demonstrates Gun Safety to School Kids 
>-- By  Shooting Himself
>Date: Fri, 07 May 2004 11:23:04 -0700
>
>Newsbrief: DEA Agent Demonstrates Gun Safety to School Kids -- By Shooting 
>Himself
>
>  5/7/04
>
>Now, here's a lesson on gun safety that will not quickly be forgotten. 
>According to Orlando, Florida, television station WKMG, an Orlando-based 
>DEA agent shot himself in the leg during a gun safety presentation to local 
>kids. The agent, whom superiors mercifully refused to name, was treated at 
>the Orlando Hospital Center after the April 9 incident and is now back on 
>the job.
>
>According to police reports, the agent drew his .40-caliber pistol and 
>removed the magazine, then pulled back the slide and asked someone from the 
>audience to look inside the gun and confirm it wasn't loaded. The pistol 
>was pointed at the floor, and when he released the slide, one bullet fired 
>into the top of his left thigh.
>
>The DEA agent's presentation was at an event sponsored by the Orlando 
>Minority Youth Golf Association 
>(<http://www.omyga.org>http://www.omyga.org). There was no explanation as 
>to the link between teen golf and gun safety.
>
>But the agent's presentation had an impact, according to witnesses. "The 
>kids screamed and started to cry," said Vivian Farmer, who attended the 
>presentation with her 13-year-old nephew. "Everyone was pretty shaken up," 
>Farmer told WKMG. "But the point of gun safety hit home. Unfortunately, the 
>agent had to get shot. But after seeing that, my nephew doesn't want to 
>have anything to do with guns."
>
>-- END --
>http://stopthedrugwar.org/chronicle/336/dea.shtml
>
>
>
>
>Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
>
>House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm
>
>
>"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
>tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
>tyranny a good conscience."
>-Albert Camus
>
>"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
>rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
>visible."
>-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"
>
>"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
>life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
>beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
>party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to 
>that..."
>-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

Subject: [sfraves] So like lastnight... Jet Trash, Urban Montage, & Fire Dancing!

OK.. so yesterday was pretty eventful in terms of what I did i guess 'cause like well...  right when I got off BART @ Embarcaderro.. i saw my cousins, Ate Elvie & Kuya Hitch (Ate (pronounced ah-teh) is who U call an older female who's like your cousin or sister before her name in tagalog & Kuya (koo-yah) is like same thing but 4 older male, often times you'll hear me say like Kuya Terry when I C him)& my Ate Elvie gave me money... LoL so that was Groovy...

Then on  Muni, I started talkin' 2 some Punk rocker dude who just moved up here from LA 6 weeks ago & was taking random trips around the Bay area public transpotation... so that was fun!

I went 2 school 2 finish taking tests (well.. i took 1 of 2 I still gotta take), saw some old clasmates from my old classes @ UOP, went & had rice w/ Bam, then went 2 Jet Trash!!  

Jet Trash was fun actually... the DJs were spinning this Awesome like Funky Happy House kinda stuff & there was this 1 song w/ like these mondo happy Chants that Todd played, it was Dope!!  I ate the yummy crab stuffed mushrooms there & it was fun 'cause i met some dude of the GS board who I've known 4 like the past 4 years by post but never met... LoL.. Lester

Anywaze. he gave me some free passes 2 check out Urban Montage 'cause he was spinning there (House) & well... I waited a while 4 Bad Kitty 2 begin & like Serephim.. but well... it was still a while where she didn't show up & well.. I went down the alley way 2 Urban Montage

Urban Montage was fun i guess.. i mean... I Loved the Deep Funky HOuse that Lester was spinning & i met some Groovy people there... Oh MY Goodness.. I saw my friend Arkayda from Russia there & we totally caught up & talked 4 a while!!!

Then I went over 2 IK 'cause i talk 2 ACME BRD & he told me he was gonna spin there.. & 4got that they had fire dancing there.. so that was Groovy... he spun this Groovy set which had his signiture TRance, B Sides, & Breakbeats tracks... it was fun!!!  I think I actuallu heard some new records in that set 'cause i know he ain't been shopping 4 vinyl in a few years... LoL

Well.. that was pretty much my night... I wish Jungle went on @ Urban Montage 'cvause I was reeeeeeeeeeally lookin' foward on seen' Ivry!!  Oh well....

So yeah.. toko bart home & well... there's a few stories there, but i gotta get my hair cut & color now.. I'm changing the blue 2 something else & I'm not sure what color yet so i hope 2 C some of y'all soon 2 share!!! =) Damn... I 4got how fun it is 2 have color hair again

Have a Groovy weekend y'all =)

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Happy Mother's Day

--=====================_13892526==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Here is the original, pre-Hallmark, Mother's Day Proclamation, penned in 
Boston by Julia Ward Howe in 1870:

Arise, then, women of this day!
Arise all women who have hearts,
Whether your baptism be that of water or of tears
Say firmly:
"We will not have great questions decided by irrelevant agencies,
Our husbands shall not come to us reeking of carnage,
For caresses and applause.
Our sons shall not be taken from us to unlearn
All that we have been able to teach them of charity, mercy and patience.
We women of one country
Will be too tender of those of another country
To allow our sons to be trained to injure theirs.
 From the bosom of the devastated earth a voice goes up with
Our own. It says, "Disarm, Disarm!"
The sword of murder is not the balance of justice!
Blood does not wipe out dishonor
Nor violence indicate possession.
As men have often forsaken the plow and the anvil at the summons of war.
Let women now leave all that may be left of home
For a great and earnest day of counsel.
Let them meet first, as women, to bewail and commemorate the dead.
Let them then solemnly take counsel with each other as to the means
Whereby the great human family can live in peace,
Each bearing after his own time the sacred impress, not of Caesar,
But of God.
In the name of womanhood and humanity, I earnestly ask
That a general congress of women without limit of nationality
May be appointed and held at some place deemed most convenient
And at the earliest period consistent with its objects
To promote the alliance of the different nationalities,
The amicable settlement of international questions.
The great and general interests of peace.




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

--=====================_13892526==.ALT--

Saturday, May 8, 2004 ** (Atmosfere) is Back! **

ATMOSFERE

After a brief hiatus Fatsouls is proud to present a very special Atmosfere =
session

As some of you may know, we have made changes to the event's schedule. Atmo=
sfere is now held intermittently as opposed to its usual monthly schedule.

Following the first two highly successful Deep and Sexy albums, Wave Music =
proudly presents the third installment in the series. This time Matthias "M=
atty" Heilbronn continues the legacy established by Francois K. and Ron Tre=
nt, crafting another masterful mix of sultry soul that keeps the pulse pump=
ing from start to finish.


Join us for the San Francisco Release party in support of the Deep & Sexy 3=
 album on Wave Music.

              Atmosfere

        (A Fatsouls Production)

     Saturday, May 8, 2004

     Club Six - 60 6 Street

     (between Market & Mission @ Jessie)

                with resident DJ Said

         (Performing "To Motherland" Live)

&

  special guest

Matthias "Matty" Heilbronn

(Wave Music, Soulflower Production, NY)

Throughout his illustrious career, Matthias has steadily achieved internati=
onal acclaim for his trademark sophisticated soulful sound: a glorious blen=
d of soulful, jazz-inflected deep house, percussive Afro-Latin rhythms and =
infectious progressive tribal beats.  He has rocked parties and festivals a=
ll over the world with his spellbinding DJ sets and seamless musical journe=
ys, not to mention receiving the #1 of the decade spot by DJ Magazine for h=
is Wave/Chez/Naked compilation CD.

+

Mauricio Aviles

(Naked Music, Loveslap Records)

&

Rasaki Aladokun

(Performing Live)

Rasaki is a miracle percussionist with over 25 years of experience.  He has=
 been a featured artist in the recording of many notable musicians such as =
King Sunny Ade, Stevie Wonder and Babatunde Olatunji to name a few. Don't m=
iss his extraordinary fusion of talking drum, conga, bongo and house music.

         Doors Open / 10pm -4am / 21+  with ID

        Cover Charge $10 before Midnight.

         www.fatsouls.com, www.wavemusic.com,
                       www.clubsix1.com

Info & reduced guest list:  said@fatsouls.com

With the third DJ series installment from the sages of soulful house - =ADW=
ave Music - =ADcomes legendary Matty Heilbronn to the decks, for a sultry a=
nd soulful ride worth every drop of sweat.   - XLR8R

Matty comes correct with this sublime mix for Wave.  And it's really rather=
 damn special, including as yet unreleased material as well as some you wil=
l already know and love... Great label, great guy!  I really can't fault th=
is.  - M8

Following on from Francois K. and Ron Trent who mixed the first two albums =
in this series is a daunting task, but Matty rides this "Wave" with gusto. =
 - Keep On

Saturday, May 8, 2004 ** Taurus presented byElektrosorcery **

 Taurus  by Elektrosorcery - The Taurean's characteristics are solidity, pr=
acticality, extreme determination and strength of will - no one will ever d=
rive them, but they will willingly and loyally follow a leader they trust. =
They are stable, balanced, conservative good, law-abiding citizens and love=
rs of peace, possessing all the best qualities of the bourgeoisie. As they =
have a sense of material values and physical possessions, respect for prope=
rty and a horror of falling into debt, they will do everything in their pow=
er to maintain the security of the status quo and be somewhat hostile to ch=
ange. Mentally, they are keen-witted and practical more often than intellec=
tual, but apt to become fixed in their opinions through their preference fo=
r following accepted and reliable patterns of experience. Their character i=
s generally dependable, steadfast, prudent, just, firm and unshaken in the =
face of difficulties. Their vices arise from their virtues, going to extrem=
es on occasion,such as sometimes being too slavish to the conventions they =
admire.  With Taurus DJs: James Dub, Valerie Sparks, Elz, Nomad, Cauze, Cyr=
us, Aaron Jae, No Left Turn, Phokus, Reclipse, Rodel, Zoe, Michael Allen. A=
nd an Elektrosorcery room by Majere and friends. Zodiac ritual room by Jere=
my S. $15 door. Infoline 415.267.6921

Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

ig doesn't celebrate mother's day. ig drinks pepsi NOT coke. ig isn't having trust issues. ig likes popsicle juice, but doesn't like the cold. here is ig's special popsicle juice recipe:
 
1 box popsicles...any flavor...ig likes blue
1 cup boiling water
 
place one cup boiling water into a large bowl. unwrap all popsicles and place into water. stir vigorously..add more boiling water if needed, but not too much, because you don't want to dilute the sweetness. serve..makes two large servings. :)
