From: Grady Broyles <polymorphic@earthlink.net>
To: SFRaves
Subject: Sun May 9th 2004 - DeepDown's Annual 'Mother'

Greetings friends...

Join us this Sunday from 10am to 6pm at the west end of Speedway Meadow
in GG Park and celebrate Mothers' Day. A superb lineup of local
favorites graces our EAW sound system to lift your spirits all day
long.  Sangria will be on hand to soothe and cool.

Your aural alchemists:
	Dave Ours [DeepDown] - Thorin [DeepDown] - Gene Steele [Infinite Kaos]
- Dave Parlier [Acme Productions] & our newest resident, Buck [frm,
Beat Down Sundaze]

Bring moms, daughters, friends, food to share, blankets, sunscreen, and
smiles.  We're just inside the park near the corners of 30th Ave and
Fulton St.  Please take public transportation (MUNI 5 Fulton to 30th)
or carpool. Remember we must leave the area cleaner than when we
arrived your help is much appreciated.  If you'd like more info or want
to get involved, don't hesitate to drop us a note or call 145-460-0141.
  As usual, it's free.  There's a bit more info at
http://polymorphic.null.bz

Hope to see you all there!

Don't forget Come Unity on the 14th, and Sunset at Stafford Lake on the
6th.  What an amazing couple of weeks of music!

With our best for your Spring,
Grady, Dave O, and all of us at DeepDown.

hey all

so like recently, some lil hoochie wild kittie was pregnant, and hangs =
around my home cuz we have food on the porch for em. . .somehow she =
ended up in my garage, and I noticed she was thinner. . .I looked thru =
the garage, and found 4 newborn kittens sleeping on my car fabric in a =
lil storage closet thing.

so I couldn't catch the mom, she's nuts. . .and since she had the =
kittens in my garage, it wasn't likely she was going to be able to feed =
them normally. I took them out from where they were, and put them in a =
nice cushie lil box. . .I went to take a shower, came back, and one was =
gone. . .=20
I couldn't find the other kitten for a couple days, till one day some =
neighbors came by saying their kids picked up this kitten in the yard =
and brought it home. . . so they were all back together again. The =
problem was, me n my relative had to feed the guys. . .we did, and have =
been for a couple weeks with lil syringes and kitten milk replacement. . =
.

they're some smart lil kitties. . .they're now like 4 weeks old, eat out =
of bowls, eat some hard food, use the cat litter. . .and it all seemed =
to just be instinct. . .=20

they're the cutest things. 2 boys, 2 girls. . .the boys- one all white =
except for lil grey ears and feets, the other is a tiger striped =
orange/white guy. . . the girls are both calico, one more brightly =
colored, and one thats really dark, almost black, but with lil bits of =
white n orange. . .=20

I have 3 other dogs here and 3 cats. . .the dogs are 2 pitts, and one =
shar-pei. . it's cute how the pitts take care and protect the kittens. . =
.since they've met, the kittens crawl all over the dogs, and one of the =
funniest things i've seen was the orange boy chasing after our 95lb =
pitt, trying to swat its nose. . .the pitt would jump around and play, =
but not touch the kittens. . .=20
Earlier, my girlie kittie tabitha was hissing at the kittens, and the =
smaller pitt came running down the hall and pushed her away from the =
kitten. My bro puppet (the shar-pei) doesn't even pay attention to them =
unless they attack his leg, then he just jumps and runs off. . .=20

today I thought it was sweet, when my kittie brian was licking the =
kittens and playing with them. . . before he used to hiss and run from =
em, but now he likes them. . .I thought it was odd cuz brians a guy, and =
aren't they supposed to kill kittens ?

I'll take pics and post the info another time. . .but in a few more =
weeks (they're much too lil now) they'll be up for adoption.=20

The boys are really independant, super playful kitties, the girls are =
lappie kinda sweet lil kittens that seem to crave people to be near them =
and lie on. . .=20

they're all gorgeous, really intelligent. . .in a bit they're going to =
get their shots n stuff. . .=20

hehe I love kitties. . .=20

: )

have a good weekend

aK

Subject: [sfraves] A whole new dot-com bust

--=====================_42029845==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed



A whole new dot-com bust



Designer drug clearinghouse linked to ex-CEO.




By J.K. Dineen | Staff Writer Examiner
Published on Tuesday, May 4, 2004

In a cautionary tale of a dot-com gone astray, police have busted a failed 
start-up CEO who had turned his spacious Mission District live/work loft 
into a haven for drug dealing and weekly raves, according to police.

John Petrik, 32, was arrested Thursday night at his 865 Florida St. loft, 
where police allegedly found 1,000 hits of Ecstasy, along with cocaine, 
pot, speed and a gourmet menu of designer drugs with names like Roxy and 
liquid X. Cops say Petrik held raves every Friday night in the pink loft 
building, charging admission and insisting that revelers buy all their 
recreational narcotics from him.

Petrik, who has a degree in electrical engineering from the University of 
Michigan, was the founder of Middle Marz, a Web-design company. The 
company's Web site boasts that "the functional works of art that we build 
exude grace, vivid exposition, and style."

Officers familiar with the investigation suggested Petrik had established 
something of a creepy cult of personality at the 3,000-square-foot loft. He 
called the weekly parties "Project There" and the space "Palace There." 
Covering the walls were Petrik's "proverbs," written on paper that was 
burnt around the edges.

The loft also had a recording studio -- called "Studio There" -- and a 
"cultivation room" for marijuana, although none was growing. The Middle 
Marz Web site contains testimonies to Petrik's attributes, written by 
friends and associates. One calls him the "most aggressive, intelligent, 
and confident person I have ever met."

"Someday you will be famous, I just wonder what for -- music, business, 
computers, inventions?" the note reads. Another writer says, "I feel 
blessed to be a part of your journey." Yet another writes, "I feel that I 
am blessed because of the honor I get every day to call you my friend."

The Ecstasy confiscated has a retail street value of about $18,000, 
according to Capt. Tim Hettrich of the narcotics division. He said police 
are seeing younger and younger Ecstasy users.

[]

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

--=====================_42029845==.ALT--

Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org> said...
> 
> 
> A whole new dot-com bust
> 
> 
> 
> Designer drug clearinghouse linked to ex-CEO.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> By J.K. Dineen | Staff Writer Examiner
> Published on Tuesday, May 4, 2004
> 
> In a cautionary tale of a dot-com gone astray, police have busted a failed 
> start-up CEO who had turned his spacious Mission District live/work loft 
> into a haven for drug dealing and weekly raves, according to police.
> 
> John Petrik, 32, was arrested Thursday night at his 865 Florida St. loft, 
> where police allegedly found 1,000 hits of Ecstasy, along with cocaine, 
> pot, speed and a gourmet menu of designer drugs with names like Roxy and 
> liquid X. Cops say Petrik held raves every Friday night in the pink loft 
> building, charging admission and insisting that revelers buy all their 
> recreational narcotics from him.
> 
> Petrik, who has a degree in electrical engineering from the University of 
> Michigan, was the founder of Middle Marz, a Web-design company. The 
> company's Web site boasts that "the functional works of art that we build 
> exude grace, vivid exposition, and style."
> 
> Officers familiar with the investigation suggested Petrik had established 
> something of a creepy cult of personality at the 3,000-square-foot loft. 
> He called the weekly parties "Project There" and the space "Palace There." 
> Covering the walls were Petrik's "proverbs," written on paper that was 
> burnt around the edges.
> 
> The loft also had a recording studio -- called "Studio There" -- and a 
> "cultivation room" for marijuana, although none was growing. The Middle 
> Marz Web site contains testimonies to Petrik's attributes, written by 
> friends and associates. One calls him the "most aggressive, intelligent, 
> and confident person I have ever met."
> 
> "Someday you will be famous, I just wonder what for -- music, business, 
> computers, inventions?" the note reads. Another writer says, "I feel 
> blessed to be a part of your journey." Yet another writes, "I feel that I 
> am blessed because of the honor I get every day to call you my friend."
> 
> The Ecstasy confiscated has a retail street value of about $18,000, 
> according to Capt. Tim Hettrich of the narcotics division. He said police 
> are seeing younger and younger Ecstasy users.
>

Wassup. Tonight is Dirtbox Radio Show #109. And as always we're bringin
you what you can't get enough of. Well, as far as drums and bass go anyways....

ODJ's busy workin on his next video of insanity, so he's most likely not
gonna be around until late. That leaves Jerel in charge. That's right, I'm
takin over today, and there's nothin y'all can do about it but enjoy the
madness that ensues.

But, enough waffle, on to the lineup.

7-8pm EST - Jerel opens the show up solo style. I'm prepared to tear some
shit up. This may be the last time ODJ will be so foolish as to leave the
show in my hands. Gotta take advantage of it, ya know?

8-9:30pm EST - Winterman - Long-time DC soldier Winterman stops by to
showcase his style of warfare. Tonight he'll be droppin bombs of the DnB
variety, and it'll be sure to cause some damage. Pay attention, or ya
might get hit with some shrapnel.

9:30-11pm EST - Relapse - This man does not fuck around. Never one to
disappoint, he knows how to tear the roof off a club. Tonight, he's gonna
tear the roof off yer house. So ready yer eardrums, collect yer precious
belongings, and prepare to be taken through the middle of a whirlwind of
beats and a thunderstorm of bass. Keep yer hands inside the ride at all times.

11pm-?? EST - Afterhours - If ODJ's slow ass hasn't made it back in time
for Afterhours, he's fired. Jerel will at least hold it down. Maybe some
special guests. Who knows? Just stay tuned, so ya don't miss out on the finale.

Subject: [sfraves] New psytrance track Moonlight Bells

Hey people,

Some time ago I listened to a track from Fiery Dawn, NightFall. I enjoyed this track a lot and proposed him to do a remix. I called the remix Moonlight Bells because I felt the bells where the essence of the track. 

It's hard to describe the track, I think it's a bit different from the ones I did before, more raw/energetic. 

Give me your opinion, Fiery Dawn and myself will enjoy your feedback.

Click the following link for the fully mastered mp3 audio track:
http://static.zed.cbc.ca/users/d/davidb/files/Fiery_Dawn_-_Moolight_Bells__David.B_Remix_.mp3

Thanks,

David.B

Subject: [sfraves] nrr. . . harry potter was just on

    hehe

ok, so i never saw any of the harry potter movies till tonight. . .cool =
movie. . .

I thought it was interesting tho, that in the movie they celebrated =
christmas, which was never a wiccan tradition, and the actual celbration =
is Yule, winter solstice (the longest night).=20
Traditional celebration of yule includes, burning of yule logs, bringing =
evergreens into the home and decorating them (sometimes decorating), =
exchanging gifts, spending time with family, wassail cups, and =
decorations of mistletoe. The tradition is a celebration of the goddess =
giving birth to the sun god (summer solstice is the death of the sun =
god, in christian/catholic religion the sun god is jesus) all of these =
traditions are pagan, and have always been so,  long before christianity =
ever came to be. . .

not like thats the only inconsistency, there really is no such thing as =
wizards, withches are simply witches, male of female. . .wizards are =
ficticious and created by storytellers and movies.

theres a ton of ideas in the movie that show that the producer had =
little knowledge of actual pagan religious activities. . . but it was a =
really fun movie still. . .if only abc didn't show friggin commercials =
every 3 minutes. . . .

anyways, just my thoughts. . .now I kinda want to read the books and see =
the other harry potter movies. . . fun fantasy stuff. . .good for kids. =
. .

: )

take care

aK

Well, they're trying to stress that he's raised in a 'normal' world.  In
the world of Harry Potter, the incredible often plays just outside the
field of vision.  Everybody at Hogwart's is normal, except that magic is
part of their way of life.  Also, regarding "Christmas", From a Christian
accuracy point of view, the date is *way* off for it to be a celebration
of the birth of christ (Christ's birth has been pegged by most scholars at
late summer/early fall).

http://www.zoomnet.net/~bbratt/jc-born.html

-&e->not like thats the only inconsistency, there really is no such thing
-&e->as wizards, withches are simply witches, male of female. . .wizards
-&e->are ficticious and created by storytellers and movies.

Um, you're choosing one cultural mythology as truth above others (I don't
blame you, the recent upswing in interest in Celtic Pagan study has
overshadowed almost all other areas... unfortunately Celtic tradition has
some of the worst corroborating documentation going back, and most texts
I've seen borrow heavily from other cultures without acknowledgement -
including the explanation you posted above (check the link, didn't read
the whole thing but it looks right from what I glanced at)... we know of
the druids, but we do not know of female witch practice in ancient British
Isle history according to any classic texts, the female witches we hear of
came from Bavaria and many of the rites practiced by "celtic" tradition
magic folk are actually Ellusian in origin).  In Slavic/Baltic magic and
folklore, there *are* wizards who are not merely male witches (although
more like 'druids' in behavior and appearance than Tolkein's wizards), as
well as witches and they play a yin and yang as far as their roles.
Their innate abilities are often used together in a complimentary fashion
to achieve goals.

-&e->theres a ton of ideas in the movie that show that the producer had
-&e->little knowledge of actual pagan religious activities. . . but it was
-&e->a really fun movie still. . .if only abc didn't show friggin
-&e->commercials every 3 minutes. . . .

Witchcraft and paganism are only tied by the Christian belief that they
are both aspects of worship outside of that dictated by scripture.  Many
cultures that practiced witchcraft were not polythestic (the traditional
definition of "pagan" is either non-Christian/Jew/Muslim or polytheist),
and many even worshipped Jesus, Virgin Mary, etc.  For many generations in
lands conquered by the Holy Roman empire or other Christian control,
witchcraft was still studied within the limits of Christianity (something
you continue to see today... in Mexico, South America, Haiti, Jamaica, and
many other places).

Of course the Harry Potter movie are set in England, so it's
understandable that you'd percieve it within Celtic culture, but the Celts
were far from the only people practicing witchcraft historically... and
have some of the worst records (little culture isolated from christian
indoctrination unlike say, Siberian Shamans or Gypsy practitioners which
we've actually been able to study in the 20th century).

-&e->anyways, just my thoughts. . .now I kinda want to read the books and
-&e->see the other harry potter movies. . . fun fantasy stuff. . .good for
-&e->kids. . .

Especially reading about them.  The movies are done really well, and it's
cool seeing kids rush to finish the books before they see them come out.

Just my $.02
andy'please don't turn me into a newt'w

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  WHICH PSYCHOACTIVE SUBSTANCE ARE YOU? by SCOTTO 

--=====================_11990271==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

We'll Be Asking The Questions Here

April 20, 2004

  I'm sure by now you've all seen those delightful Internet personality 
quizzes, where you answer a pile of questions about your personality, and 
are rewarded with answers to questions you had previously never thought to 
ask: Which anime character are you? Which Dungeons & Dragons character 
class are you? Which French region are you? Which version of the popular 
prime time television franchise "Law and Order" are you? Which syphilitic 
side effect are you? Etc.

In the spirit of continuing to make the Internet as pedestrian as humanly 
possible, while at the same time perpetuating a wide range of offensive 
stereotypes that completely undermines the overall mission of the Vaults of 
Erowid, I am proud to present the latest and greatest Internet personality 
quiz for your enjoyment:

  WHICH PSYCHOACTIVE SUBSTANCE ARE YOU?

Now the key to this quiz is to just react ­ don't spend time thinking about 
your answer. For the vast majority of you, this will not be a problem. 
Also, please be completely truthful and forthright ­ otherwise you won't 
get an honest result, and also, the NSA will not be able to properly update 
your file.


The music I most enjoy listening to at a party is:

         1.      Extremely repetitive thump-thump music that makes me shake 
my fist in the air and feel very good about myself for no discernible reason

         2.      Crazy improvisational rock and roll where the reason I 
have to follow the band from town to town is that I don't know when they're 
going to get around to playing the end of that song I like

         3.      Unnerving experimental jazz performed by torturing the 
parents of the musicians, recording their screams, and using them as the 
emotional foundation for ironic aural explorations of the motifs of modernity

         4.      Bombastic classical music that must be enjoyed lying 
prone, blindfolded, cocooned in an isolation tank, after twelve years of 
silent meditation atop a mountain peak on the far side of the world, having 
eaten nothing but dirt and wind, in order to appreciate the true majestic 
godlike genius embodied by the viola line throughout the final three measures

         5.      Art Garfunkel


The thing I most want to be remembered for after I die is:

         1.      The sheer amount of honey-dipped good vibrations I spread 
to all the good peoples of this magical planet

         2.      The staggering breadth of my contributions to vital fields 
of medicine, science, and research

         3.      The incredible amount of ammunition and explosives I had 
hidden on my person at the time

         4.      The serene and peaceful look on my face that tells whoever 
finds me that I did not die in pain, no matter how much blood is on the walls

         5.      My sofa ­ I really like my sofa


If I were a snack food, I would most likely be:

         1.      A huge, monster-sized bag of cheese puffs

         2.      An artfully arranged assortment of crackers and cheeses 
from around the globe

         3.      A whole pig, roasted in a freshly-dug pit for twelve hours

         4.      Candied orange wedges made out of a synthetic foodstuff 
based on matter found only on asteroids

         5.      My own vomit


When entities emerge from the walls attempting to communicate, my first 
reaction is to:

         1.      Reach out with my heart and send powerful messages of love 
and friendship

         2.      Put down the pipe ­ I've had enough

         3.      Attempt to steal their wallets

         4.      Rip their fucking throats out with my teeth for 
interrupting the really good sex I was having with the police chief's kid

         5.      Ask myself, "What would Jesus do?"


When I snap back to consciousness, only to find myself on a Greyhound bus 
heading for the border, covered in filth, muttering incoherently and not 
wearing pants, I usually:

         1.      Laugh it off and chalk it up to another lesson from the 
Trickster

         2.      Bum a smoke from the recently paroled murderer next to me

         3.      Attempt to stop the hemorrhaging

         4.      Make mental note: that was fun, but probably didn't get a 
threshold dose

         5.      Begin shouting "Turn this bus around or I will introduce 
you to my bodyguard, BEERBELLY THE INVISIBLE CLOWN, and his MINIONS OF 
INFERNAL LAUGHING MENACE!" Then, kill myself


Okay, let's tally up your score! For each time your answer was 1, give 
yourself three points; for each time your answer was 2, give yourself five 
points; for each time your answer was 3, give yourself eight points; for 
each time your answer was 4, give yourself ten points; and for each time 
your answer was 5, give yourself 1,027,433 points. Perform a fast Fourier 
transformation on the partial products of the point values associated with 
each answer. Then take a Cartesian product of those values with the 
original answers that you provided, followed by a Gram-Schmidt process on 
the results, treating each as a polynomial. Calculate the standard 
deviation. When you have an answer, set yourself on fire. In your flailing 
death throes, the answer will be revealed to you, as though a veil was 
being peeled back allowing you to see the true machinery of the universe 
(do not mistake your skin peeling back for the veil peeling back ­ it's a 
common error). You will at that moment know yourself as one of the 
following psychoactive substances:

Ecstasy ­ You are truly at one with the inherent bliss and wonder of 
reality, and are showered with blessings at every turn. Your heart is open 
to a wide range of emotional contexts, and your friendships and 
relationships are deep, meaningful, and annoying to other people. You get 
spare changed a lot and recently lost your car on the classic "59 Switch" 
con, even though instead of a gorgeous eighteen-year-old as the bait, the 
scammers used your own grandmother.

  Marijuana ­ Nothing interferes with your ability to have a good time. 
Responsibility takes a back seat to a great rekkid on the stereo and a home 
cooked meal. It's the simple pleasures in life that mean the most to you: a 
good conversation, a long weekend, remembering your own name when asked 
several times by the person who is almost your ex-boss. You pride yourself 
on still being able to count to four, as long as both hands are not in 
handcuffs and you do not actually need to count to four.

  Acid ­ Your sharp, analytical mind is suffused with a questioning nature 
that puts you in regular contact with the fundamental issues that define 
humanity as a self-conscious organism. You know well the gnosis that comes 
from such heightened understanding, and you are at peace with your 
mortality. Which is good, because you have been lost on the streets of 
Chicago for several years now, wondering where the hell your apartment is 
and why won't they stop shouting inside your head.

Speed ­ If anyone comes any closer, they will die by your sure and steady 
hands. For weeks, you have waited patiently for this moment, and now by the 
grace of a god you do not believe in, you can take your pick of any of a 
dozen federal agents on your lawn, who believe you are on the second floor 
of the house, when in fact, you are cleverly hidden ten feet away in a tree 
house made of twigs, cigarette butts, and part of your own small intestine. 
Your breath is not particularly fresh.

2-TC-Special-G ­ You should be so lucky.

That's it for this month's edition of eScottology, friends! Tune in next 
time when we lock Myers and Briggs in a room, dose them with datura extract 
when they aren't looking, and webcast their wacky antics as they struggle 
helplessly to comprehend the way the ceiling seems to be threatening them 
in Portuguese!

[Shout out to GuruStu for the complex statistical modeling in this quiz.]



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

check em all out!

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  Come-Unity 13th Anniversary Friday

--=====================_8802176==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed


It's been almost a year since the last Come-Unity so we hope you are ready 
for what will be a rockin' night.  Proceeds from this event, our 13th 
Anniversary, will benefit Andie, an old friend and our first doorperson for 
many years. Andie is bravely fighting serious illness and will  really 
appreciate our support. There is a rumor she may even do the door for an 
hour on Friday night. You'll recognize her by her gorgeous smile.

So please get your most comfy shoes on and come down to 'MIGHTY!', a great 
new venue that features the old Townsend Sound System, revamped, painted 
and ready for some wicked tunes. -- Malachy O'Brien


COME-UNITY 13TH ANNIVERSARY PARTY

Simon
Jeno
Garth
Cosmic Jason
Charlotte the Baroness

Club Mighty, at 15th and Utah
$10 before 11PM, $15 after.  21+

 From an early Come-Unity flier:

"When used with positive intention, group energy has the potential to help
restore the plan of Love on Earth...When you open your heart, and trust the
whole group you dance with,  when you feel love with everyone, and they
return it, a higher viberation can be reached.  This happens when a crowd is
deep into the vibe of House...In the true sense of rhythmic movement, the
effect is to align the physical, mental and emotional bodies with the
Oneness of All that Is...Don't put out negative energy and feelings.  Leave
the old ways behind.  Throw yourself into the winds of transformation and
sow the seeds for a new world -- one where the human family is together
again.  When people respect and care for each other as a
community-organism...Spread the Peace!"



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

--=====================_8802176==.ALT--

>appreciate our support. There is a rumor she may even do the door for an 
>hour on Friday night. You'll recognize her by her gorgeous smile.
>
>So please get your most comfy shoes on and come down to 'MIGHTY!', a great 
>new venue that features the old Townsend Sound System, revamped, painted 
>and ready for some wicked tunes. -- Malachy O'Brien
>
>
>COME-UNITY 13TH ANNIVERSARY PARTY
>
>Simon
>Jeno
>Garth
>Cosmic Jason
>Charlotte the Baroness
>
>Club Mighty, at 15th and Utah
>$10 before 11PM, $15 after.  21+
>
>>From an early Come-Unity flier:
>
>"When used with positive intention, group energy has the potential to help
>restore the plan of Love on Earth...When you open your heart, and trust the
>whole group you dance with,  when you feel love with everyone, and they
>return it, a higher viberation can be reached.  This happens when a crowd 
>is
>deep into the vibe of House...In the true sense of rhythmic movement, the
>effect is to align the physical, mental and emotional bodies with the
>Oneness of All that Is...Don't put out negative energy and feelings.  Leave
>the old ways behind.  Throw yourself into the winds of transformation and
>sow the seeds for a new world -- one where the human family is together
>again.  When people respect and care for each other as a
>community-organism...Spread the Peace!"
>
>
>
>Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
>
>House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm
>
>
>"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
>tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
>tyranny a good conscience."
>-Albert Camus
>
>"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
>rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
>visible."
>-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"
>
>"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
>life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
>beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
>party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to 
>that..."
>-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

- let me install the software I need to use etc.

Any suggestions?

On Mon, 10 May 2004, Apollo wrote:

> Date: Mon, 10 May 2004 20:08:10 -0700
> From: Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org>
> To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
> Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  Come-Unity 13th Anniversary Friday
>
>
> It's been almost a year since the last Come-Unity so we hope you are ready
> for what will be a rockin' night.  Proceeds from this event, our 13th
> Anniversary, will benefit Andie, an old friend and our first doorperson for
> many years. Andie is bravely fighting serious illness and will  really
> appreciate our support. There is a rumor she may even do the door for an
> hour on Friday night. You'll recognize her by her gorgeous smile.
>
> So please get your most comfy shoes on and come down to 'MIGHTY!', a great
> new venue that features the old Townsend Sound System, revamped, painted
> and ready for some wicked tunes. -- Malachy O'Brien
>
>
> COME-UNITY 13TH ANNIVERSARY PARTY
>
> Simon
> Jeno
> Garth
> Cosmic Jason
> Charlotte the Baroness
>
> Club Mighty, at 15th and Utah
> $10 before 11PM, $15 after.  21+
>
>  From an early Come-Unity flier:
>
> "When used with positive intention, group energy has the potential to help
> restore the plan of Love on Earth...When you open your heart, and trust the
> whole group you dance with,  when you feel love with everyone, and they
> return it, a higher viberation can be reached.  This happens when a crowd is
> deep into the vibe of House...In the true sense of rhythmic movement, the
> effect is to align the physical, mental and emotional bodies with the
> Oneness of All that Is...Don't put out negative energy and feelings.  Leave
> the old ways behind.  Throw yourself into the winds of transformation and
> sow the seeds for a new world -- one where the human family is together
> again.  When people respect and care for each other as a
> community-organism...Spread the Peace!"
>
>
>
> Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
>
> House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm
>
>
> "The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of
> tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of
> tyranny a good conscience."
> -Albert Camus
>
> "Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the
> rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become
> visible."
> -Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"
>
> "I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of
> life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the
> beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club,
> party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
> -Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  Xhale @ Shadow Lounge : Thursday :  ICON

well, due to situations beyond our control, we had no breaks at shadow 
lounge last thursday.  it was a sad, and dark day for san francisco.  but 
this week we are back with a vengence!!!  our special guest this week is DJ 
Icon, whom you older SF heads may remember as a trance DJ...but she's now 
seen the light and is spinning breaks.  others may now her as the DJ on 
MTV's Wade Robson project.  she recently opened for the Chemical Brothers at 
Mezzanine during their latest tour of the US.

also on the decks, Evil Breaks residents Aaron Jae and M.O.D.  Also, 
Influence is back again to rock the decks.

Xhale @ Shadow Lounge
9th and Folsom
10pm-2am
21+, Free

Icon (djicon.com, Mach 5, Sister NYC)
Aaron Jae vs. M.O.D. (AaronJae.com/Evil Breaks)
Influence (Static Productions)

Well have an all star guest line up including world famous Ganja Guru, Ed Rosenthal, Pot attorney and head of NORML Bruce Margolin, and Editor in Chief of High Times, Richard Stratton. Well also be discussing and displaying hydroponic technology and some useful products for the pot smoker in your family amongst other things.

The show is broadcast internationally and in over 40 million homes in the U.S. on the Techtv network. This is a great opportunity to come and get a behind the scenes look at what it takes to tape a tv show and be an intergral part of it's success, as the hosts (Martin and Laura) and their guests will feed off of your enthusiasm as an audience. We offer tokens of appreciations/prizes for those audience members who show the most enthusiasm

help

trust the

Man, I wish people still thought and spoke this way..  I've found what
is written above to be utterly true, on the right night with the right
mix of people and music..  If somebody wrote that on a flyer these
days, you'd be able to hear the calls of "F**kin' e-tards!  Hahaha" for
miles!  We need to get some hope and euphoria back into the scene.

Dhur, now I sound like all the 15-year old candykids who post going,
"Where'd the plur go, yo?"..  :)

George

MIME-Version: 1.0

X-Spam-Rating: localhost.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] BSP:  Come-Unity 13th Anniversary Friday

Woah,

I have a flyer similiar to this from Come-Unity with *almost the same
text* - one side has "Heal Our Mother Earth" with many things you can do
to change the world we live in in a positive way, such as suggestions for
activism, hazardous products, recycling, transportation, pesticides/eating
habits, trees, home energy use, water conservation - ending with the
quote:
"We all have a responsibility to the earth." "Learn to love it and treat
it right."

On the other side is the text

House Music and Planetary Healing

When used with positive intention, Group Energy has the potential to help
restore the Plan of Love on Earth. If you have been exploring House
parties, or have found a home in them, you will, of course, be aware of
the intoxicating Energy leveles reached sometimes, both personally and
collectively. It is possible to understand better the Energy we tap into
and take it a step further. There are many preliminary ingredients to
becoming spiritually aware, and even more to be able to focus and channel
Energy. Those aspects can be discussed another time. For now, this is what
can be done for that moment: OPEN YOUR HEART!!!

Wen you open your heart, and trust the whole group you dance with; when
you feel love with everyone, and they return it, a higher vibration can be
reached. This happens when a crowd is deep into the vibe of House. What we
have here, when the crowd is open is the ability to access some extremely
beneficial Energies, and focus them instead of losing them. Down through
the ages this knowledge has been available to the few who have been able
to recognize it; it seems the House Nation has tapped in.

In the true use of rhythmic movement, the effect is to align the physical,
mental, and emotional bodies with the Oneness of All that is. And this
lining up, when coupled with intense aspirations of love and high
desire,"...results in a downflow of Force from illumination. When an
entire concourse of people is thus animated by a single high desire, when
their auras blend and form one united channel for the downflow, the effect
is tremendously intensified and can be WORLD WIDE IN ITS RADIUS." [Alice
A. Bailey, 1919]

Help push the consciousness another level into Enlightenment. It's up to
each of at the party (rave) to make it happen. Don't put out negative
energy and feelings. Leave the old ways behind. Throw yourself into the
winds of transformation and sow the seeds for a new world--one where the
human family is together again. When people respect and care for each
other as a community-organism. It's up to us to spread the vibe.

Spread the peace!
You can make a difference.

--Oldskool Come-Unity flyer, circa 1992 or so
transcribed by karina

:)

Peace
Love
Unity
Respect,
-- 
**************************************************************
******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************
If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so
much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************
**************************************************************

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:UPLIFT-Viberation Reunion


hey all, this is a quick tease for this thursday, it is a free shindig at 
the Sublounge (20th and 3rd st) in SF 2$ tecates, 3$ wells
I would not be involved in the scene if it weren't for these guys, so that 
is why I wanted to dedicate this night to them.  If you all have just 
started partying, you should really take a look at the roots of the SF 
underground scene.  Viberation was a group of wonderful, amazing kids, 
friends and dj's who really knew how to play.  That is why I love them.  
There was a cafe in santa clara off of Stevens Crk and Lawrence xpwy called 
City Espresso (City E) Where I was the local barrista which had clientelle 
of folks such as Shane (CODE-when he was a computer guy before the djing), 
Greg Sandler, AndyW, Alex, Mike McGursky, Terry, Paula, Matt Schmidt, Vlad, 
AndyW Li, Micron Pyro, ...the whole gang, very great people.  It is too bad 
that they do not play together all that much anymore, The last party I 
really remember was at the Brookdale Lodge in the  SC mountains, a halloween 
party...off the hook. but this thursday a good chunk of them will be playing 
for you, for free.
here is the tease:
starting out we have our very own Calamity Jane to butter up Micron and Dan 
gorlick who will be tagging some sweet progressive Lick the Micron-typ-a 
tunes, from there we have Li Sasaki who is going to fuck with our heads in 
the way he did recently at Primero de Mayo, after Li, his twin brother, 
AndyW will be rocking us out to finish up the night and to give us something 
really good to dream about (no, not that you big pervert)
Apparently Noah is living outta state as well as Alex (siphon and Science) 
so they could not make it.  Maybe down the road.
Hopefully we will see you all there this thursday, may 13th
Peace,
Danny retired- bAByHueY

At 01:24 PM 5/11/2004, georgeC wrote:
> >  From an early Come-Unity flier:
> >
> > "When used with positive intention, group energy has the potential to 
> help  restore the plan of Love on Earth...When you open your heart, and
>trust the  whole group you dance with,  when you feel love with everyone, 
>and they return it, a higher viberation can be reached.  This happens when a
>crowd is deep into the vibe of House...In the true sense of rhythmic 
>movement, the effect is to align the physical, mental and emotional bodies 
>with the
> > Oneness of All that Is...Don't put out negative energy and feelings. 
> Leave > the old ways behind.  Throw yourself into the winds of 
> transformation and
> > sow the seeds for a new world -- one where the human family is together 
> again.  When people respect and care for each other as a
> > community-organism...Spread the Peace!"
>
>Man, I wish people still thought and spoke this way..  I've found what
>is written above to be utterly true, on the right night with the right
>mix of people and music..  If somebody wrote that on a flyer these
>days, you'd be able to hear the calls of "F**kin' e-tards!  Hahaha" for
>miles!  We need to get some hope and euphoria back into the scene.

Wicked (Jeno, Markie, Garth and Thomas) brought rave culture and music from 
the UK to the Bay Area, along with Malachy O'Brien, Martin of the Gathering 
and other rave pioneers in the early 90s. They showed us that raving was 
not just an all-night "party" but rather a new paradigm for human 
interaction -- bringing love and respect to the dance floor and then into 
our lives. Those nights totally transformed my life for the better, and I 
owe these ravers much of what is good in my soul today.

The Wicked dancefloor was often the beach. It was an awesome experience to 
dance all night with the full moon above reflecting onto the ocean to 
cutting edge house music with an excellent sound system. Then watching the 
sun come up and dancing on till noon or so. We really felt like brothers 
and sisters then, and one with the natural forces around us.

When we weren't celebrating the full moon we went to parties like 
Come-Unity where that vibe continued.

Malachy, even though paralyzed from the neck down in an accident coming 
back from a Wicked FMR, kept Come-Unity and that original raver spirit 
alive, and if you come this Friday you will see him in his wheel chair 
grooving with the rest of us. Remarkable man.

For those of you who don't know about Malachy, Come-Unity and the Full Moon 
Raves:  http://www.sfbg.com/AandE/34/10/lead.html

Much love,

Apollo




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

--=====================_17583233==.ALT--

Subject: [sfraves] NEWS: NRR: Psychedelic @ 60


URL: http://www.mapinc.org/drugnews/v04/n700/a10.html
Newshawk: chip
Votes: 0
Pubdate: Wed, 05 May 2004
Source: Salisbury Post (NC)
Copyright: 2004 Post Publishing Co.
Contact: letters@salisburypost.com
Website: http://www.salisburypost.com/
Details: http://www.mapinc.org/media/380

PSYCHEDELIC AT 60

An increase in habitual marijuana use among U.S.  adults overall is
troubling news -- but it gets downright unnerving when you break down the
data.

Over the past decade, according to government figures released Tuesday,
marijuana abuse or dependence has increased 22 percent among adults in
general.  Yet when you narrow the field to those between 45 and 64, the
rate increased by a stunning 355 percent.

As with so many other demographic anomalies, blame the baby boomers.  A
lot of aging stoners apparently are little inclined to go gently into that
good night without their bongs or roach clips.

This isn't what Congress meant in supporting a drug benefit for the
elderly.  Any drug addiction is bad.  But considering the inevitable
physical decline that aging brings -- from slower reaction times to poor
night vision -- it could be especially dire for older abusers.  You don't
want a bunch of toked up geriatrics rushing out in their Buicks to cure
the late-night munchies.  For that matter, you don't even want them ahead
of you in the cafeteria checkout line, dazedly fumbling for senior
discount cards.

Turn on, tune in and drop out may have seemed cool in the psychedelic '60s
-- but it's a definite bummer in the arthritic 80s.
-- **************************************************************

much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.

Viberation hosted Ascension 2 years ago. That was one hell of a night
musically. I only have Science's set from that night though. I'll never
forget when we did the Paranormal party at Brookdale. So much time and
effort went into that event and it was all produced in a month. Nothing
beats having a halloween party in a spot that really is haunted. I still
have the glow in the dark oiji board in my room from that night. Sadly Noah
and Alex have moved away. Hopefully a party from Viberation will occur again
soon and all that great talent will be present.

http://www.viberation.com/ryan/paranormal/index.htm - Pictures from
Paranormal. 4 years ago nearly... woah.

I think I'll have to come out an say hello for this one.

>clientelle

> > really remember was at the Brookdale Lodge in the  SC mountains, a
>halloween
> > party...off the hook. but this thursday a good chunk of them will be
>playing
> > for you, for free.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] nrr. . .Mystery skin disease report tonight at 10

hey all

heres the latest ktvu report (from last night):
http://www.ktvu.com/video/3293470/detail.html


and heres the first one:
http://www.ktvu.com/video/2888865/detail.html

ktvu is odd, I thought cathy was going to be in this one, but it was wendy.
. they certainly aren't much for communicating, but they deserve respect
being that they're the first and one of the major networks keeping up with
this. I wonder why like ABC hasn't jumped on. ..

also, the people coming out with this publicly deserve our gratitude. . .tho
i haven't had any badd experiences yet from people who've seen me on there.
. .I'm sure some people, like maybe concerned parents who have kids who go
to school with infected kids, might have issues with it. . .

a thought. .. the area near my house where footage was taped, on the bay,
near this water treatment plant, is now a big housing development. . .Does
anyone know if I could be prosecuted/sued or whatever somehow if i was to .
. .like put up flyers and pass out flyers telling these people they may be
living in a dangerous area with potentially hazardous parasitic organisms
which may or may not create life threatening situations for them, their
pets, and their children ? Like if the people suddenly wanted to move out,
and possibly sue the development company. . .could they go after me cuz I
basically caused the peoples leaving ?

Also if interested, I have letters to the CA state health dept. and their
response to the letter. .. (not the one wendy sent, but another friend, the
morgellons research foundation founder). I could paste them into an email or
send the attachment. ..

take care all

: )

aK
----- Original Message ----- 
From: "aK" <aK@hard-grooves.com>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Monday, May 10, 2004 6:18 PM
Subject: [sfraves] nrr. . .Mystery skin disease report tonight at 10


hey all

There will be broadcast on the continuing epidemic of this mystery skin
disease airing tonight on ktvu-2 at 10pm.

some of us call it morgellons, a name given to children with a similar
disease thru europe in the late 1500 thru 1600's. . . you can read about
morgellons at www.morgellons.org

this should be a large scale broadcast partly based on the previous ktvu
report, and should be the one originating from a news agency in washington
with a friend of mine who I met over a year ago thru a related message
board.

check it out. . .it will most likely also be available in the next few days
thru ktvu's website. . .

there also will be an upcoming USA Today report on this subject. . .along
with many other news agencies. . .

take care all
don't forget to take your minerals

: )

aK

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] BSP:  Come-Unity 13th Anniversary Friday

some people still do talk like that...

do you remember when people stopped calling them 'raves' and started 
calling them 'parties'?

i do, and if i remember correctly, that's about the time that the scene 
started to lose its sense of optimism.  lots of people got 
disillusioned, perhaps from making raves their whole LIFE, aided by a 
dependence on drugs that allowed them let loose and believe in that 
optimism.

now that i think about it, all my fuddy-duddy geriatric raver friends 
and i have something in common: we kept balance in our lives, and made 
an effort to spend time with each other outside of the scene.  PLUR is 
easy when your serotonin levels are through the roof. but take it 
outside of the venue, and it's not only more rewarding - it's genuine, 
and infectious.

so, if you want to get that hope and euphoria back, start meeting 
people outside of the scene, and start taking them to good underground 
events... it works - trust me.

-philip-

> > deep into the vibe of House...In the true sense of rhythmic movement,
the
> > effect is to align the physical, mental and emotional bodies with the

right now. If someone sends you the link, do yourself a favor and DO NOT 
watch it. It is possibly the most disturbing thing I have ever had the 
misfortune of seeing in my entire life.

you want to know what happens to our citizens because of our fucked up 
government - but trust me, you will feel AWFUL after seeing it. Just know 
that it is 100% real, and that it is 110% horrible.

> > > sow the seeds for a new world -- one where the human family is together
> > > again.  When people respect and care for each other as a
> > > community-organism...Spread the Peace!"
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
> > >
> > > House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm
> > >
> > >
> > > "The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of
> > > tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of
> > > tyranny a good conscience."
> > > -Albert Camus
> > >
> > > "Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the
> > > rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually
> become
> > > visible."
> > > -Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"
> > >
> > > "I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of
> > > life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the
> > > beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club,
> > > party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to
> that..."
> > > -Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves
> > >

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: American Hostage Execution

I haven't seen it. . .I don't know if I will. . .

but you know that "ignorance is bliss" saying. . .

it's reality, these things happen. . .ignoring the fact that they happen
doesn't make it not happen. . .
sure most people shouldn't watch it, most people would probably be very
disturbed I'm sure.

but I feel personally, that some people should be aware and see, and
understand the things that are happening.

the thoughtless murders all over the world are an all too simple "cut n dry"
kind of situations, with little emotion or feeling by the person perfoming
them.

I think that potential murderers especially should be familiar with the
emotional connection, and feelings involved in such an act.

Like the sec of defence, or the president. . .they're ordering people to
kill all sorts of people left and right and don't think twice about it (or
even once really). . .but if the same people were to actually witness the
acts they were responsible (over and over), than I'm sure they would be much
more thoughtful of the entire issue before they so lightheartedly make such
orders. . .

I think witnessing such brutal acts should be encouraged. . .I bet the same
people would never look at a simple murder the same way. . .death is death.
. .it's no less wrong for a military officer to simply shoot someone, or
even something like "lethal injection", than it is when someone kills
another by any other means. . .Television especially has created the idea of
murder being a simple and acceptable act, but it's much much more involved
than that.

Take for example, that situation where the dea agent accidentily shot
himself during a gun safety assembly at a school. If the children didn't
directly witness the officer shoot himself, I doubt the children would have
had such strong feeling on the subject.

inhumane treatment. . .?
Humans kill. . . killing is killing. .. theres no nicer or meaner way to do
it. . .the worlds full of pain and torture of all sorts.

they all do it and theres no excuse. . .

to me the victim in this situation was somewhat innocent of the charges
against him (wasn't he building comm towers there for work?)
I ask you all, would you have the same feelings if you viewed the same
murder of a US military official who was known for killing many others ?
Probably not. . . some might even think he deserved it. . .but the act
itself wouldnt be any more justified.So then it ends up being more of a
disgust in the treatment of the specific person, than it is a disagreement
with the idea of murder, which I believe overall is wrong.

murder is the culprit here, and it's a world that we all have created and in
ways supported, so realistically we're all partly responsible. It doesn't
matter who or how they're murdered, killing in general is wrong.

If somehow the US recorded effects of their massive bombing, where i'm sure
many innocent (if anyone really is) mothers and shildren slowly burned to
death, lost limbs, were slowly crushed, whatever. . . then it would be a big
deal. And it does/did happen, and still happens, and no one cares simply
because they aren't direct witness to it and have lil or no emotional
involvement.

people don't fully realize that when they go into the military, they will
take others' lives. They make light of it, being brutal or not, using
excuses like they're fighting for their freedom, etc. But then those same
people get all broken up when their "enemy" does the same to them. . .


it's fucked up. . .but it's reality.

not to sound like I have no feelings for this guy or his family, but
honestly. . .what about the many many thousands and thousands of others. . .
the situations to me are no diffirent. . .murder is murder in all shapes and
forms. . .

I think the world needs to be more aware of the consequences of their
horrible acts, and not just knowing the consequences, but knowing and
understanding deeply, the acts which they commit and have part in.Actually
feeling the emotional implications of their actions.To me it doesn't matter
if they do it or we do it. . .it's all wrong, and it's everyones
responsibility.

I'm curious to see the future horrible acts our "wonderful" country is going
to commit in retaliation of this single well known act. Would there be much
retaliation of any kind if it was a simple unrecorded kidnap and murder
(even if it he was beheaded also, but not on tape). . .I doubt.

I bet if there was no video, hardly anyone would care, he would just be a
casualty. . .so in my opinion it was good that it was recorded, and gives
people a chance to (in a way) experience the acts they think and feel so
little for.

*I couldn't find the video on the consumption junction site ? Was I looking
at the wrong one ?
And yknow Adult Friend Finder (I got a popup ad from the site). . .aff
works, I've gone to a few aff events and had a few "encounters" myself.
Interesting people, I always ended up being the cute lil boy being hit on by
all these overrage couples wanting to take me home with them.I'm not
actively involved with aff these days tho.(like on a lighter note).*

but yeah,

I think the recent events that have been recorded and photographed have
given us a lil more insight into some of the normal daily actions our world
is committing. Overall I think people needed to see these things.

take care

aK

but given how much horrible shit like this goes on daily I can't be shocked
by it. I've been saying this elsewhere...

Death is death. Murder is murder. Killing is killing.

Just because it was an American in Iraq that got beheaded on video doesn't
change anything. Think about all the horrible shit going down in African
nations lately let alone all the shit that happens in our backyard. How many
people have been murdered in the bay area since the new year? Yeah... It's
all the same to me. It's all fucked up.

:: r ::

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: American Hostage Execution



Yes, it is horrible.  It has really gotten me thinking... war is hell.

Yes, the terrorists pretty much started the bloodshed on 9/11.

America responded with overwhemling bloodshed.

Now, they will return it in kind.

The madness will never end.  Its really up to us, the better nation, not
to respond to bloodshed with more bloodshed.  Becuase really, it just
will not ever end.  Not until one side can get control of their primal,
animal instinct of eye-for-an-eye and come to an solution that does not
rely on more bloodshed.

The war-hawks cry "We must not stop until every one of the evildoers are
dead!"

Guess what?  They are thinking the same thing. 

War is hell.

-troy

here. It's the appeal to emotion. When I first saw it I had to wonder if it
was all just fabricated Wag-The-Dog style. Now wouldn't that be a hoot if
the whole thing was a fake and done by our own guvment just to get the
country riled up in support of the war effort? Well, perhaps it would be
more uttery disgusting that we would stoop so low. I should say I'm pretty
sure that this isn't a fake, but that 1% in my mind makes me wonder...

Well you have to know what you're getting yourself into if you download a
video about a hostage getting decapitated! I expected to see a head cut off
and hear screaming. I also expected a lot more blood and gore but it wasn't
there. Damn Hollywood! Honestly the act of beheading someone is disturbing
and oddly fascinating. It's something you hear about but never see. For
those that can stomach it I think it's good to see just how animalistic the
human race can be.

> > > > tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the
servants of
> > > > tyranny a good conscience."
> > > > -Albert Camus
> > > >
> > > > "Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of
the
> > > > rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually
> > become
> > > > visible."
> > > > -Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"
> > > >
> > > > "I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects
of
> > > > life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on
the
> > > > beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no
club,
> > > > party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to
> > that..."
> > > > -Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves
> > > >
> > >
> > > ---------------------------------------------------------------------
> > > To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
> > > For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org
> > >

>> ENGAGE!!! <<

Friday, July 16th 2004

@ Kelly's Mission Rock in San Francisco

This is an 18+ event

roof for a single night to impress everyone.

* Four areas of music

* 100% Fully permitted venue

* Two bars for the 21+

* Indoor and Outdoor settings

* Plenty of parking

I thought I already sent this but i didn't see it on sfr. . .

excuse it if you've already seen it. . .


> I haven't seen it. . .I don't know if I will. . .
>
> but you know that "ignorance is bliss" saying. . .
>
> it's reality, these things happen. . .ignoring the fact that they happen
> doesn't make it not happen. . .
> sure most people shouldn't watch it, most people would probably be very
> disturbed I'm sure.
>
> but I feel personally, that some people should be aware and see, and
> understand the things that are happening.
>
> the thoughtless murders all over the world are an all too simple "cut n
dry"
> kind of situations, with little emotion or feeling by the person perfoming
> them.
>
> I think that potential murderers especially should be familiar with the
> emotional connection, and feelings involved in such an act.
>
> Like the sec of defence, or the president. . .they're ordering people to
> kill all sorts of people left and right and don't think twice about it (or
> even once really). . .but if the same people were to actually witness the
> acts they were responsible (over and over), than I'm sure they would be
much
> more thoughtful of the entire issue before they so lightheartedly make
such
> orders. . .
>
> I think witnessing such brutal acts should be encouraged. . .I bet the
same
> people would never look at a simple murder the same way. . .death is
death.
> . .it's no less wrong for a military officer to simply shoot someone, or
> even something like "lethal injection", than it is when someone kills
> another by any other means. . .Television especially has created the idea
of
> murder being a simple and acceptable act, but it's much much more involved
> than that.
>
> Take for example, that situation where the dea agent accidentily shot
> himself during a gun safety assembly at a school. If the children didn't
> directly witness the officer shoot himself, I doubt the children would
have
> had such strong feeling on the subject.
>
> inhumane treatment. . .?
> Humans kill. . . killing is killing. .. theres no nicer or meaner way to
do
> it. . .the worlds full of pain and torture of all sorts.
>
> they all do it and theres no excuse. . .
>
> to me the victim in this situation was somewhat innocent of the charges
> against him (wasn't he building comm towers there for work?)
> I ask you all, would you have the same feelings if you viewed the same
> murder of a US military official who was known for killing many others ?
> Probably not. . . some might even think he deserved it. . .but the act
> itself wouldnt be any more justified.So then it ends up being more of a
> disgust in the treatment of the specific person, than it is a disagreement
> with the idea of murder, which I believe overall is wrong.
>
> murder is the culprit here, and it's a world that we all have created and
in
> ways supported, so realistically we're all partly responsible. It doesn't
> matter who or how they're murdered, killing in general is wrong.
>
> If somehow the US recorded effects of their massive bombing, where i'm
sure
> many innocent (if anyone really is) mothers and shildren slowly burned to
> death, lost limbs, were slowly crushed, whatever. . . then it would be a
big
> deal. And it does/did happen, and still happens, and no one cares simply
> because they aren't direct witness to it and have lil or no emotional
> involvement.
>
> people don't fully realize that when they go into the military, they will
> take others' lives. They make light of it, being brutal or not, using
> excuses like they're fighting for their freedom, etc. But then those same
> people get all broken up when their "enemy" does the same to them. . .
>
>
> it's fucked up. . .but it's reality.
>
> not to sound like I have no feelings for this guy or his family, but
> honestly. . .what about the many many thousands and thousands of others. .
.
> the situations to me are no diffirent. . .murder is murder in all shapes
and
> forms. . .
>
> I think the world needs to be more aware of the consequences of their
> horrible acts, and not just knowing the consequences, but knowing and
> understanding deeply, the acts which they commit and have part in.Actually
> feeling the emotional implications of their actions.To me it doesn't
matter
> if they do it or we do it. . .it's all wrong, and it's everyones
> responsibility.
>
> I'm curious to see the future horrible acts our "wonderful" country is
going
> to commit in retaliation of this single well known act. Would there be
much
> retaliation of any kind if it was a simple unrecorded kidnap and murder
> (even if it he was beheaded also, but not on tape). . .I doubt.
>
> I bet if there was no video, hardly anyone would care, he would just be a
> casualty. . .so in my opinion it was good that it was recorded, and gives
> people a chance to (in a way) experience the acts they think and feel so
> little for.
>
> *I couldn't find the video on the consumption junction site ? Was I
looking
> at the wrong one ?
> And yknow Adult Friend Finder (I got a popup ad from the site). . .aff
> works, I've gone to a few aff events and had a few "encounters" myself.
> Interesting people, I always ended up being the cute lil boy being hit on
by
> all these overrage couples wanting to take me home with them.I'm not
> actively involved with aff these days tho.(like on a lighter note).*
>
> but yeah,
>
> I think the recent events that have been recorded and photographed have
> given us a lil more insight into some of the normal daily actions our
world
> is committing. Overall I think people needed to see these things.
>
> take care
>
> aK

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"

     Just like it's important not to feel more disturbed when a black or 
white person is killed. It's just as important to not be more disturbed when it's 
an American or Iraqi who is killed. Granted being beheaded on film is way more 
shameful and humiliating than die-ing in battle, but what do you expect an 
enemy to do when we have killed 10's of thousands of their people in battle and 
they were only able to capture one of ours? Do you think they are gonna call 
Dr. Kovorkian and pay thousands of dollars to give him a nice peaceful death? 
Are they gonna buy dinner for him and give him a lil room to stay in till he 
gets rescued? Of course not, these recent events, as disturbing as they are do 
not surprize me. 
     I'm equally disturbed when I read the newspaper heading, and in big 
letters it says 12 AMERICAN'S KILLED IN OUR MOST DEADLYEST MONTH IN IRAQ! and then 
in small letters, later on you read aproximately 2,000 or so iraqi renegades 
were also killed. Now don't get me wrong here getting beheaded really sux, I 
can hardly imagine, and I don't really crave to see the video... BUT on the 
bright side, it is quite instant is it not? It would be hard to chose dieing in 
the dessert heat from multiple gun shot wounds or having  your limbs blown off 
with a hand granade as the prefered alnertative way to go... Is it really that 
hard to imagine that these thousands of Iraqi soldiers are only following 
orders just as ours are? Are they not just as inocent? Just as brave? Would our 
soldiers even be considered brave if all their soldiers just rolled over and 
never attacked back? 
          It's disturbing to know that our president probably won the 
election through a huge amount of religous voters, and yet when push comes to shove 
he pretends like he's never even heard of half the ten commandments... thou 
shalt not kill, thou shalt not covet thigh nieghbor's goods, thou shalt not use 
god's name in vain... etc. I mean when you look them up in the bible they don't 
have a little asterix next to them where it says *except in certain cases 
when you're really mad about two buildings falling down...   then go right ahead &
 proceed to start a god damn holly war biotch!* I don't recall seeing that 
written anywhere in the scriptures.
      A war, and much worse a war in god's name "good vs. evil" is clearly 
sacreligious by the most basic priciples of almost every religion. If we can't 
suffer wrong doing and turn the other cheek, we might as well be evil ourselves 
in the eyes of those on the outside, and therefore expect to be punished as 
such whenever vulnerable. I mean if our intentions for war are atheist, or 
agnostic and purly of logical motavation that's another story, but don't go 
throwing around religious motives to defeat an enimy and then cry about it later 
when they don't play fair or when you don't get unanimous support from the more 
sensible allies. 

p.s. appologies for ranting about such an edgy topic as religion, but to me 
that's exactly what this war is all about, and that's exactly why we can't be 
clear cut right & wrong. It all just simply has to end, even if that means 
admiting to a mistake. Think like the enimy... what does an Iraqi renegade believe 
in? What does al queda believe in? Attack the root, attack the epitomy, 
debate, evolve, compromise. Don't murder the outer shells of the innocent. (I don't 
know exactly who i'm telling this to, I'm just saying this stuff in general, 
and i think i'm right about it...)

--part1_1d1.20bdf1f5.2dd48621_boundary--

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: American Hostage Execution

	I like the idea of heads of state having to lead the charge on the 
battlefield. If such a concept had been in effect, it might have 
rendered the war in Iraq unnecessary -- Saddam Hussein would already be 
dead from leading the charge against Iran or Kuwait (the two countries 
he went to war with).

	Of course the odds of leaders going for this are just about zero. But 
there is a more practical policy change that could have a similar 
effect: When a situation arises where it seems like removing the rulers 
of a country will save lives but they won't go peacefully, instead of 
launching a war that claims the lives of many innocent civilians and 
ordinary luckless soldiers, just keep sending in highly paid, highly 
skilled hit teams or undercover assassins to go after the leadership 
(in this case Saddam and his cronies) until they take them out. If the 
people who take their place turn out to be bad apples too, keep taking 
them out until there's a decent government in power that respects human 
rights.

	I believe this way of "making it personal" would encourage retaliation 
in kind so that instead of ordinary Americans like those who died on 
Sept. 11, 2001  being at risk, dictators and tyrants would go 
tit-for-tat by targeting George Bush, Donald Rumsfeld, Hilary Clinton, 
and the rest of the gang on Capitol Hill. I could live with that.

Power to the people!
						<<< Starchild >>>

Subject: [sfraves] SRR: SH*TLOAD OF HOUSE RECORDS FOR SALE!!!!

Ok - since PayPal and Bank Of America hosed me hardcore today, I need $$ 
like crazy as I'm taking my car into the shop this weekend and need all the 
$$ I can get.

So tonight I will release a list of well over 90 house 12"s for sale. If 
anyone is interested, I will be taking offers and setting up appointments 
for people to come listen/pick through what I have for sale.

I have stuff dating back a few years, labels like Red Melon, Moody, NRK, 
Tango, Siesta, etc. It's mainly deep house, tech-house, and some funky and 
loungey stuff. Everything from the SF sound to Chicago, to UK deep/funky 
styles. There are some 2x12"s & 3x12"s , some harder to finds, etc. I'll 
pretty much keep everything to Amoeba bargain bin type prices with very few 
exceptions  - and if someone wants to buy the whole shebang I'll drop it a 
smidge lower (I can't go TOO much lower than $2 a record due to neccessity).

Anyway - thought I'd give peopel a heads up now in case they wanted to 
pre-arrange something. I live in the east bay (El Cerrito area) and will be 
home from work around 4:30pm.

Ez.

Subject: [sfraves] SRR: Sample this

Listening to local DJ and producer mixes, an idea popped in my head. I
have many CDS from local artists, but no compilation / mix CD of several
artists. I am interested in producing such a CD to give exposure to the
many local artists who may or may not have the production resources at
their finger tips. Anyone here interested in submitting their work for
consideration? If successful, many genres of music will be represented,
and several other compilations will follow. This idea is in the alpha
stage @ the moment, and definitely open to input. Please email
suggestions, creative ideas, wishes, samples, thoughts and constructive
concern to: karina@hyperreal.org

--

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:UPLIFT-Viberation TONIGHT!


hey all, here is the dealy deal,   a free shindig at the Sublounge (20th and 
3rd st) in china basinin SF 2$ tecates, 3$ wells
Tongiht will be the final party we do here at the sublounge too.  Thank you 
all who have come out and supported what we weren't even sure what we were 
doing to begin with :P  The AuraSf kids will still be up on their even on 
the same night so be sure to check out the sick grooves that they all put 
together for they have been great kids to play with, thanksguys!

okay, the event, VIBERATION
www.viberation.com
I would not be involved in the scene if it weren't for these guys, so that 
is why I wanted to dedicate this night to them.  If you all have just 
started partying, you should really take a look at the roots of the SF 
underground scene.  Viberation was a group of wonderful, amazing kids, 
friends and dj's who really knew how to play.  That is why I love them.  
There was a cafe in santa clara off of Stevens Crk and Lawrence xpwy called 
City Espresso (City E) Where I was the local barrista which had clientelle 
of folks such as Shane (CODE-when he was a computer guy before the djing), 
Greg Sandler, AndyW, Alex, Mike McGursky, Terry, Paula, Matt Schmidt, Vlad, 
AndyW Li, Micron Pyro, ...the whole gang, very great people.  It is too bad 
that they do not play together all that much anymore, The last party I 
really remember was at the Brookdale Lodge in the  SC mountains, a halloween 
party...off the hook. but tonight a good chunk of them will be playing for 
you, for free.

Calamity jane8-9
Lick the Micron 9-11
Li Sasaki 11-12:30
AndyW 12:30-close
here is the tease:
starting out we have our very own Calamity Jane to butter up Micron and Dan 
gorlick who will be tagging some sweet progressive Lick the Micron-typ-a 
tunes, from there we have Li Sasaki who is going to fuck with our heads in 
the way he did recently at Primero de Mayo, after Li, his twin brother, 
AndyW will be rocking us out to finish up the night and to give us something 
really good to dream about (no, not that you big pervert)
Apparently Noah is living outta state as well as Alex (siphon and Science) 
so they could not make it.  Maybe down the road.
Hopefully we will see you all there TONIGHT, may 13th
Peace,
Danny retired- bAByHueY

to smacken-backen und fix de morkin, yøobetcha! "
-The Swedish Chef

Mime-Version: 1.0
