Subject: [sfraves] nrr. additional Morgellons (mystery disease) article-n thoughts

------=_NextPart_000_0121_01C43DFE.1C2571A0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

hey all

check it out. . .

http://www.kbcitv.com/x5154.xml?ParentPageID=3Dx5157&ContentID=3Dx53603&L=
ayout=3DKBCI.xsl&AdGroupID=3Dx5154&NewsSection=3D


yknow to be honest with everyone. . .all this media attention is good, =
but frustrating. . .
I see so many people saying they have these cures but I know they aren't =
cures at all. . .
People thinking lyme is the base of the problem. . .
people thinking they know what this is cuz they've seen similar symptoms =
before (which appear similar but are completely unrelated). . .
lots of misinformation going around. . .

. . .=20

it's gonna start really pissing me off as organizations start jumping on =
the bandwagon just for the sake of jumping on the bandwagon. . =
.especially when they couldn't have cared less a while back when most of =
us were emailing them like crazy. . .=20

it's good but it can get bad, the media exposure I mean. . .people need =
to know they aren't alone, but theres a point when all sorts of issues =
start coming up from the huge amount of people reading these reports who =
may or may not have this disease. . .some of them have called me after =
getting my phone number somehow. . .which I don't really mind, but . . =
.gets kind of intense in ways. . .not the illness itself (even tho it is =
truly scary intense and horrible imagination defying stuff), but the way =
people are reacting to the information they're being exposed to.

we need a cure yeah, I guess the real work towards that goal comes well =
after the mass hysteria part. . .=20

in a way it's like one of those situations where you're talking to =
someone and they're just sitting there, not really paying attention, =
just waiting for their turn to say what they thought up during the time =
you were telling them how to help themselves. . .never really listening =
to anything but the one or two words that spark their attention here n =
there.

dude, one guy was even arguing with me, saying that it was all the work =
of witches who would come out after the world was in chaos and heal =
everyone so they could take over the world. He talked about an ex gf, =
that hexxed his car when they broke up and made the engine seize, and =
how he was reading a book about some christian something or other and =
his gf said in some evil voice "what are you reading". . .

I don't live my life for the same reasons others do. . .sometimes it's =
best for me to just watch and listen and wait and see. . .difficult for =
me tho,

what a friggin universe we live in. . .most of you prolly don't know =
what I mean, or where I'm "getting at".

its ok tho. . .


. . .=20

I'll keep everyone updated,=20

take care

arycK


------=_NextPart_000_0121_01C43DFE.1C2571A0--

Subject: [sfraves] I'm back from AZ =)

Phoenix AZ was fuckin' Awesome man!!!  Good fuckin' Shit!!  I mean... the scene there from what i'm told is totally small & yeah... it needs some fixin'& all that... anywaze... la la la.. that's whooooooooole another story...

So my highlights of my time there:

---> I got a New Tatoo!! YAY!!!  I Fuckin' Love it!! Good Fuckin' Shit man!

---> Hello 2Day, I had a car while i was there!!!!!!!!  YAY!!1  It was so Awesome bein' free again 2 fuckin' drive & man.. just like drivie period man... LoL.. serously.. I almost drove the car back here 2 Cali 'cause I Loved my car so much!

---> I got 2 spend time w/ my Big Bro DJ DMX... I mean... seriously man.. y'all have 2 understand that me & this dude have been Homies 4 like the past like 5-6 years & we been planning like 2 meet up here or like when he lived in Denver.. but he moved 2 AZ like almost a year ago now & we talked like 2 months ago.. on impulse i (well.. my Mom) bought a ticket that night & yeah... so like we totally got 2 talk & catch up on eeeeeeeeverything (we spent a whole mondo chuck of the time talkin' about music ofcourse 'cause we got the same tastes in music & stuff) & D always has this way of kicki'n my ass & giving me the best advice about what needs 2 B done in my life when i can't see it... actually.. we had 1 of the best best best conversations lastnight that totally well... it put sooooooooo many things in2 perspective!!  I'm hella fuckin' buggin' still from lastnight's talk..

---> I got a new Bro... Mi aka Miah aka Jerimiah aka DJ 3cnal who spins yummy breakbeats!!  LoL.. Mi was literally my 24/7 goin' out partner 'cause I made him go w/ me 2 all the weeklies & that RAve on Saturday as well as day time ventures!!  I Love this kid.. he's a trip!

Things that were lame:
---> OK.. yeah.. the heat there is a givien... soooooo good 2 be back here where the temp is well... it our fuckin' weather & I LOVE IT!

---> Drivers there suck fuckin' Ass.. I swear man... there was never a moment that i drove on the highway or on some road where some dumb shit totally would break 4 no reason, cut me off, or i dunno... but it was sooooo lame!  Grrrrrrrr on AZ Drivers!!! >:O

---> ya know... I think that's about it... in all honesty... i wish i got 2 stay there 4 a few more days 'cause I dunno... it was nice bein' w/ my Big Bro again & just absorbing everything... I was totally fuckin' balling almost kinda on the way 2 the airport 'cause I was sad & it was nice living responsiblity free 4 a while... but ya know... gotta get back in the swing of things... when i started like getting close 2 here... I was like well... my mentality started changin' & well... I know what i gotta do now & I seriously have the stength 2 accomplish my goals now!!

OK.. la la la.. i'm sorry 4 goin' on & On & On.. but I would Love 2 throwdown w/ y'all soon 'cause if 1 thing, we got a beautiful thing goin' on here!!  It's sad that Phoenix & AZ & stuff is still workin' 2 what we got!!  But they'll get there soon! =)

aK <aK@hard-grooves.com> wrote:umm. . .

anyone hear about this. . . kind of odd, I hate it when people send me these chain letters. . .especially if they're making money off it. . . if it's real. . .

>Dear Friends; Please do not take this for a junk letter. Bill Gates sharing 
>his fortune. If you ignore this, You will repent later. Microsoft and AOL 
>are now the largest Internet companies and in an effort to make sure that 
>Internet Explorer remains the most widely used program, Microsoft and AOL 
>are running an e-mail beta test. 
> 
>When you forward this e-mail to friends, Microsoft can and will track it ( 
>If you are a Microsoft Windows user) For a two weeks time period. 
> 
>For every person that you forward this e-mail to, Microsoft will pay you 
>$245.00 For every person that you sent it to that forwards it on, Microsoft 
>will pay you $243.00 and for every third person that receives it, You will 
>be paid $241.00. Within two weeks, Microsoft will contact you for your 
>address and then send you a check. 
> 
>Regards. Charles S Bailey General Manager Field Operations 
>1-800-842-2332 Ext. 1085 or 904-1085 or RNX 
>292-1085 Charles_Bailey@csx.com Charles_bailey@csx.com 
> 
>I thoug! ht this was a scam myself, But two weeks after receiving this e-mail 
>and forwarding it on. Microsoft contacted me for my address and withindays, 
>I receive a check for $24,800.00. You need to respond before the beta 
>testing is over. If anyone can affoard this, Bill gates is the man. 
> 
>It's all marketing expense to him. Please forward this to as many people as 
>possible. You are bound to get at least $10,000.00. We're not going to help 
>them out with their e-mail beta test without getting a little something for 
>our time. My brother's girlfriend got in on this a few months ago. When i 
>went to visit him for the Baylor/UT game. She showed me her check. It was

That's right, the full on dirty, sweaty sheets style house grooves are
what we've got going on right now on An Epiphany Of Sound!!  Courtesy of
Markiss Anthony.  He's been laying a bit low, working on his first
release, but he's taking time out today to make you sweat.  Be sure to
listen in, 90.1 FM and online at http://kzsulive.stanford.edu


http://www.jcthedj.com

-- 
Every vote counts -- unless it's counted by Diebold.

KZSU Radio or Stanford University." (or words to that effect.)

X-Originating-IP: [24.6.152.191]

To: "Calamity Jane" <scarpetta80@yahoo.com>,

References: <20040520162614.61248.qmail@web12703.mail.yahoo.com>
Date: Thu, 20 May 2004 10:43:40 -0700
Organization: The Gospel According to Jack
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Priority: 3
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 6.00.2800.1409
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2800.1409
Message-ID: <BAY8-DAV25knc5zy9ha0001320e@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 20 May 2004 17:43:40.0626 (UTC) FILETIME=[FCD5B320:01C43E91]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Re: REVIEW: [sfraves] hybrid!

let me start this by saying....I'm hurting. My eyes are bloodshot, my head
hurts, and you know when you are sooo hung-over that the toothpaste sticks
to your mouth because you have cottonmouth? That's me. (yh I know pretty
picture) . I called work at 9 am to tell them I'll show up when I'm
ready...lol.

..so you all probably figured out by now it was a f*cking blast. I don't
even know where to start.

..um, so well it began last Monday, when I found out from a certain other
dj, that this was going to happen and basically to keep my yap shut. So
sorry if I wasn't able to share it with ya. Which in the end really didn't
matter, because the place was packed like sardines in a can. So armed with
this information I called up Jason Lee to let him know and of course sent
out a page to Calamity, cause I know she loves hybrid and kind of left it at
that.

Warmed up the night by having some pints at Thirsty bear, with jason, and
reminiscing of time when Mike-Red used to lay it down there and how lame it
is today with the stereo playing and the dj booth empty. Stayed until about
9 ish and then realized it was time to go when I started arguing with the
bartender because he didn't have any Del Dueno Tequila and that Patron
wasn't gonna substitute. Ended up drinking the tequila with the deer on
it...ehh harsh.

Walked down to sixth to see all the beautiful people, and walked into a very
very empty Anu...not for long. Found Scott and gave him a copy of my new
mix. Met up with JC, had some more pints. Literally get done with my first
pint and I am not kidding you turn around and it is like a wave of folks
coming in...."steady" and "a lot". Oh well secret's out it appears. I
actually found out later that someone was outside of Qool telling people.
Which is cool, but, if you know how big 111 is compared to anu, you know
this is not gonna work out. lol.

So turn back around and there is Jason chatting it up with Hybrid like they
are old football mates...very cool, they seemed like nice folks.

By 11 - 1130 the place is soo packed you can barely get a spot on the
sidewalk to smoke....I'm thinking at this moment 2 things: 1 - images of a
great white concert and 2 - I hope no one has to leave in a hurry.

So standing outside and who do I see, mr sf breaks guru BAMMER! And of
course it is business as usual with him, meetin folks, gettin his flyers
out, etc. etc. Good night for him to be promotin the event this Friday, lot
of break heads there. Chatted it up with him and then realized there was no
way I was gonna make it back inside. At midnight, there are still people
showing up.

Hybrid rocks. It wasn't a live set, but none the less, great breaks being
played. And you could hear it outside which was more than satisfactory for
me.

So, armed with a pack of smokes and a pocket full of flyers I forgot to pass
out, I chatted it up with Bam, Kevin knapp was there, jeff allen, jackie,
shelly, jc and I am sure I saw someone else. Basically just jumped
conversation's and listened to the tunes...hopefully I didn't make too much
of an ass out of myself.

Sobered up and left about 2 am, when I realized that alcohol doesn't fill
your stomach as nicely as a cheeseburger and went off in search of food.
Completely lost track of Jason, who rang me about 3 am to say he was trying
to find his car. lol.

I love surprise gigs.
--
DJ Jack Triumph
Minister of Infinite Progressive Onslaught
_____________________________________
"I saw an Angel in the Marble,
and carved until I set him free"
- Michelangelo

jack@jacktriumph.com
www.jacktriumph.com

AIM: DJJackTriumph
Yahoo: Jack_Triumph
MSN: jacktriumph@hotmail.com

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] hybrid!

DJ Set the last time and the time before was a 3 hour DJ//Live set at
Kelly's Mission Rock (Thump). Let's just say one of the 3 guys canNOT
fucking mix to save his life let alone beat match. Maybe the boy had too
much to drink. I dunno. It was painfully bad. The music they were playing
was far too soft and lacked the Hybrid edge that so uniquely defined them
within the soft world of progressive. I bought the new CD and was let down
by the lame, wandering male vocals and the go-nowhere tracks. It was as if
Hybrid got their nuts cut off and no longer had the balls to put out the
edgey music they used to.

I can only hope that they're BACK playing what they should be and not
playing//putting out the crap that's on their new CD. That CD is a POS
compared to Wide Angle and all of the countless remixes circa that time...

:: r ::

From: Calamity Jane <scarpetta80@yahoo.com>

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] hybrid!

i like morning sci-fi - it's definitely a change, but
what i like is they span a number of genres, and the
vocals do work for this album's intended feel.  only
gripe i have is i saw the sci-fi dvd - the singer
grandstands and does this aerosmith/robertsmith
performance on stage.  during lulls he flails around
in some quasi-passionate rage trying to get immersed
in the music but in my eyes, failing.  what i'd like
to see is a vocal performance akin to underworld - now
*they* blow me away.

and i don't think progressive is 'soft'..i've heard
enough to call it anything but.  if it sounds like
their balls were cut off, that's what we'd call
charmin prog.  2 ply is the best!

Subject: Re: [sfraves] hybrid!

The vocals suck. Period. Morning Sci-Fi is a waste of their talent. I never
bothered to watch the DVD that came with the CD. I hated the CD so much it
got stuck in my closet and hasn't been pulled out since. Hybrid went soft.
I've heard progressive not be soft. I've heard Hybrid not be soft.
Especially in a lot of their remix work. That no longer applies to them. It
really pisses me off too if you can't tell. That's why I looked at the
Ascension thing and saw that they were playing and said fucknoway.

Underworld. Hell yes. Seeing them when they were last here at the Warfield
was awesome. Same with Orbital at the same venue. Hybrid 3 years ago - HELL
YES. If you can find their set on Thump or can get a copy of it, well, THAT
is how they should sound.

:: r ::

> what i like is they span a number of genres, and the
> vocals do work for this album's intended feel.  only

> grandstands and does this aerosmith/robertsmith
> performance on stage.  during lulls he flails around
> in some quasi-passionate rage trying to get immersed
> in the music but in my eyes, failing.  what i'd like
> to see is a vocal performance akin to underworld - now
> *they* blow me away.

> enough to call it anything but.  if it sounds like

hello, this is a continuation of a fictional piece:
 
ig was reading on the internet while supa baby watched. 
"i'm stuck", said ig.
"why are you stuck, ig?", asked supa baby.
"well, i erased all the virus', and now i am sorry that i did.", replied ig.
"why's that, ig?", inquired supa baby.
"well, i know that i don't want a virus, but also, i forgot to study the ones that i did get, and now they are all gone. ", said ig.
"maybe you can ask to have them sent again.", said supa baby.
"yes, maybe.", said ig. :)

Date: Fri, 21 May 2004 08:26:48 -0700
Mime-Version: 1.0

Message-ID: <BAY18-F13D1XZflnxEb0003cf16@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 21 May 2004 15:26:48.0912 (UTC) FILETIME=[08AF5500:01C43F48]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  MASH-UP : Tonight! : Breaks in yo' face!

ok folks, here's the final BSP from me.  i promise after this i'll shut up.  
;)

Mash-Up is goin' down tonight in the east bay, just minutes from the bay 
bridge.  We've got a secure, beautiful venue that I'm sure you'll enjoy and 
a slammin' lineup of DJs.  This party will be bangin' all night from 9pm til 
4am.

I'm not sure what else I can say to entice you to come join us or to hype up 
those already planning to attend.  I'm positive tonight is going to go off 
and I hope to see you all there!  Here's all the info for the party.


MASH-UP
presented by Evil Breaks
Friday, May 21st
9pm-4am
18+

Featuring DJs:

Odeed - (Moonshine/LABA/W.E.)

Odeed is simply one of the sickest producers and dj's/turntablists around. 
He has had multiple releases on Moonshine Green with fellow producer Bionic, 
and his style of breaks easily distinguish him from other producers. He's 
had many affiliations including Moonshine, C.T.W., Downtown Dwellars, 2 
Covert Capin's, and of course L.A.B.A. One of his most recent performances 
in the Bay (May, 2003) was at 1015 where he opened up for Uberzone, and we 
are proud to bring him back again for a performance not to be missed.

vs

DJ Wish (W.E. - Baltimore, MD)

Originally hailing from Balmtimore, MD dj Wish has made a name for herself 
with her unique style of breaks. She has had many residencies to include, 
The Edge (DC), Tracks (DC), and The Spot (Baltimore). She has also worked 
closely with Shaken Not Stirred Records, Deep Rising Productions, F(x) 
productions, and she has performed at the world famous Buzz (Nation) in 
Washington DC. Odeed and Wish are currently working on a few tracks 
together, and this event is going to be part of their nation wide tour to 
promote their new label W.E. Recordings. I've been told we might get to hear 
some unreleased tracks that are sure to tear up the dance floor.

Evil Breaks Room:

9-1030 M.O.D.  (Evil Breaks)
1030 -1130 Bam vs Nick Nyquil  (Evil Breaks / Invibe / Xhale / Onieromancy / 
Ill Bahavior)
1130 - 1230  A:Dubl  (Breakthru)
1230 - 2 Odeed vs Wish (Moonshine / W.E.)
2 - 3 Majere - Special Breaks set  (Electrosorcery)
3 - 4 Aaron Jae vs Athena  (Evil Breaks / Seekr / Xhale / Gravity Crew)

Chill Room hosted by the Ambient Mafia:

9-10:45 Harken
10:45-12 Skye
12-1 Stickyboy
1:00-1:45 Boomerang Fidget
1:45-2:45 dj Fieldsoe
2:45-4 Drop

This event is being held in Emeryville and is 18+ with a full bar for those 
over 21.  Free fruit for everyone to enjoy.  Free mixed CD from Aaron Jae 
for the first 200 guests.

Presales: $7
Door: $10

Tickets are still available at Skills, F-8, and Solid Groove.
More Information:

Call info line for directions to the event:
408.278.5211

www.EvilBreaks.com


-------------
< Brandon / DJ Bam >

DJ Bam - serving breaks and beats
http://www.invibe.com/bam

Download the new mix online!
-------------

MSN Money. http://special.msn.com/money/0405streamline.armx

Subject: [sfraves] Ascension review

------=_NextPart_000_7047_2f7c_51a5
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed



so I went last year had an AMAZING TIME!, I went this year, reminded by my 
coworker (thank god)  This is simply one of THE BEST PARTIES IN SF!  I got 
off work, meandered into the main room, while wanting to make out with 
everyone, mind you....and hybrid was playing, what a way to get outta work, 
just off the hook!!  I have been doing this "party thing" for a long time 
and it is just simple.  Fashion show, fire dancing, BEAUTIFUL people, 
exceptional music... for ten bucks.  I got there and had to run up and give 
Benjy a hug, he had no idea whoi it was and took a bliind picture, always 
sporting his camera (thank you for the wonderful pics Benjy!!)  GO next year 
if you get the chance.  It is funny too, the only 2 times I have been to 
1015 folsom have been for this event, so why does eveyone say it is a shitty 
venue?  hahah, just kidding
So worth it, and if you didn't go, poopy!
It was great to see all my friends from Santa Cruz, representin' the 
moontribe as always, as well as Brandon, John Wood, Terrence and Galaga... 
and boy oh boy
Do any of you remember Jello and Fubari???
well I saw Jeff aka Jello and holy shit does he look good ;)
he is getting ready to move to LA if anyone cares, apparently Ari aka Fubari 
is living in colorado and is married with kids (I always thought those boys 
were gay)
oh well, if you don't know these too, I have spent many of debaucherous 
evennings with them and many other friends WAAAAAY back in the day (circa 
True Love, lepidoptera)  He mentioned hellos to Macadio and Micron (that is 
prolly all he could remember :P)  *waving from Jeff
That was the top of the night for me, always wondered what happenned to 
them.
anyhoot, I just had my redbull awakenning and now am crashing again (yay 
sleep)
have fun and a good one!
Danny Picard

pictures by benjy:
http://pics.feen.com/ascension-20040520

"Øder tis moodle in der noggin tu smacken der ouchey und vinger-slingers ur 
to smacken-backen und fix de morkin, yøobetcha! "
-The Swedish Chef

"why do you want to know?"

"we are all destined to have a crush on her, because someday or now or very soon, we are all 42 years old watching t.v., and who could possibly resist good time flo?"
"oh, okay...i guess i have a long, long way to go."
"yes, you do, but just pay attention to the older people, and then you'll know exactly what to do and exactly what to say if your brain shoots out on you like it does to a lot of people."
"ig."
"yes, supa."
"i'm tired."
"someday, you won't even know your tired if your like everyone else."
"cool. i saw what you mean, by the way. i was sort of thinking about that."
"okay, bye. " :)

		
---------------------------------

Subject: [sfraves] Jet Trash, Bad Kitty, & Urban Montage lastnight!!  Good Shit!

OK.. so like lastnight it was my Homegirl's Birthday (Dhoris) & she booked Cloud 9 2 have her party... so we got there around like 8:30... since it was still Happy Hour @ Anu.. I went over there & hung out w/ the Jet Trash fools!!  Gosh man.. I Love those Cats so much!  Harry bought me a drink & we ate a platter of Stuffed mushrooms w/ crab.. yum!!  Todd was on the decks spinning this Urban R&B set.. smooth!

Went back 2 Cloud 9 & there was this House DJ spining some yummy deep house!! Had another drink & socialized w/ Dhoris's party of friends... some i knew...

Sharp walked in & as soon as I saw him.... seriously.. it felt like "Hello 2Day, I'm ready 2 B saved from the awful Jungle weeklie experience i went 2 on Monday" 'cause yeah... he told me that they would drop downstairs soon... so then around like 10:30, went back 2 Anu 4 Bad Kitty 'cause ofcourse i had 2 hang out w/ my Darling Lushy Lush Serephim!!  OK.. Hello 2day.. she threw down some fuckin' Awesome Electro Clash tunes trhat had me goin' on the dancefloor!11  Oh MY goodness, Hello 2day, I net Lil' Miss Trouble Mayka Herself... Subsista!!  LoL... You're Groovy Girl!!! =)

BUt alas, i went back 2 Cloud 9 & Urban Montage was in like Mondo Full effect!  Upstairs, seriously, there was this Dude doin' a Live Prog House set on his keyboards & drum machines, as well as a live bongo drum player & some dude playing sax!!!  YUM!!!  But the real fun 4 me happened downstairs in the basement... woooooooohoooooooo.... Sharp busted out some hard ass fuckin' Jungle... I guessin', not sure, but he played alota Dub & even harder than that.... But oh yeah.. I just had 2 like totally lose myself in the music & I was like "Hell Fuckin' yeah, I need this" & I was just feelin' so proud 2 B a Junglist from the Bay Area!!! WOW!!!

Back upstairs, the DJ started playin well.. disco house w/ prince songs... it sounded yummy 4 a while, but eh.. it started getting tired & I realized it was only catering 2 the drunk girls who ooooh my gosh.. I walked back in the club from a ciggy outside.. bumped in2 this girl who like grabbed my shoulder then proceeded 2 put her leg on my shoulder & started dancing.. really... it was so trippy & kinda scary 'cause she looked @ me doin' that tongue thing.. ooooh my gosh... thanks god she was drunk 'cause i kind pushed her hgently 2 get off me... eeeeuuuuuuugh

Upstairs they started spinning house breaks after that as well.. it was good!

But downstairs, Mal & Ivry hopped on the decks!!! YUM!!!  OK... so  yeah... Mal got on the decks & like sontinues the hard shit... Ivry got on a few records later & like brought the vibe down a few notches, but fuuuuuuuck man. I need these Jungle sets soooo bad!!!!  I mean.. ya'll know how it is when u experience something musically mondo eeeh & U need something 2 replace that feeling... so that was exactly what I needed lastnight!!

It was Dope.... I mean.. bumped in2 heeeeeeella people when i was there.. Cameron, Angelica, oh gosh.. some girl who i haven't seen in a year in the last EK @ AsiaSF! It was so fun! & such good medicine...

OK.. well.. that's it 4 now!!!  I'll C some of y'all or all y'all @ Mash Up 2night!!!  I need my refuelin now in Breakbeats!!!  I heard there's an after party @ Ryan's pad!!!  LoL :) jk

Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

Subject: [sfraves] need a place to live?  i need help!

hey all.

so one of my roomates has decided to bail (thanks for the notice!) and now i
am left trying to find roomates in the next two weeks BEFORE I LEAVE THE
COUNTRY.

so, i need to find two new roomates for a wonderful apt in oakland (very
conveniently located between piedmont, lake merritt and downtown -- near
BART and ac transit and the 580) by june.  you can move in mid-june to july.
one room is $350 and the other is $550 (somewhat negotiable...we haven't
totally set the rent).  the whole house will be shared by all, even though
it's divided into two units -- upstairs and downstairs -- but we're turning
it into a co-op-y type space.  there is a HUGE living room downstairs where
we plan to throw super parties.

need more incentives:  hardwood floors, beautiful views, awesome location,
big windows, excellent people...

PLEASE.  i desperately need this, otherwise i have no place to live.

if you're interested, hit me up with an e-mail.

if you know anyone who's interested, please tell them to contact me.

thanks.

*emma*

_down/map.htm

n DJ Buck.

s keep the park clean, even if it isn't your mess.  And that even though th=
ere's enough parking, it is better for all of us if you use MUNI or at leas=
t carpool.

If you or people you know are doing similar things in GG Park, We ask that =
you contact us so we can open lines of communication that can help protect =
all of us into the future. We need to build community rather than compete!!=
 there's plenty of love to go around!

s keep the park clean, even if it isn't your mess.  And that even though th=
ere's enough parking, it is better for all of us if you use MUNI or at leas=
t carpool.

If you or people you know are doing similar things in GG Park, We ask that =
you contact us so we can open lines of communication that can help protect =
all of us into the future. We need to build community rather than compete!!=

Saturday, May 29, 2004 ** Promise for Peace Festival **

We invite peace supporters of all ages and walks of life to join us for
the premier of

=94Promise for Peace: The Interactive Peace Festival=94

Just 25 miles North of the city, tucked in the rolling hills of Marin Count=
y lies the serene Stafford Lake Park. Here we will gather for a full day of=
 networking and celebrating the diverse resources of our growing global pea=
ce movement. This is a benefit fundraiser for the Indigenous
Elders and Youth Peace Gathering.

Promise for Peace will be a festival of interactive attractions featuring l=
ive music, DJ's, workshops, performance arts, indigenous speakers, arts and=
 crafts, tasty natural foods, renewable energy expos, healing arts, art ins=
tallations, circus performers, and presentations by peace and justice organ=
izations.

Live music and DJ=92s on two stages with over 12 bands:

The Mix (an all-star cast with Melvin Seals-Jerry Garcia Band and members
of Dark Star Orchestra, Zero and Phix
Hamsa Lila (a live world trance experience)
DJ Dragonfly
Tom Slik
Sasha Butterfly
Tina Malia
Shimshai
Company of Prophets
Reorchestra
The Garrin Benfield Band
JP Cutler Band
Shakina feat. Soul Rebel
Wendy De Rosa
Hyim
Samantha Lee
Aphrodesia
The Original Intentions
and more.

Performance arts featuring the hottest Bay-Area crews such:

The Mystic Family Circus
Tezkatlipoka Aztec Dance
Destiny Arts Youth Performance Company

Indigenous Speakers:

Robert WhiteMountain (Lakota, The Midnight Strong Heart Society)
Corbin Harney (Shoshone, Shundahai Network)
Jene McCovey (Yurok, Woman=92s International League of Peace & Freedom)
Emcee Robert GreyGrass (Lakota, Award Winning Actor)

Special Guests:

Wavy Gravy
Starhawk
Kevin Danaher

Workshops:

=94The Local, Green Economy, Our Greatest Weapon
Against Empire=94 with Kevin Danaher of Global Exchange,
=94Non-Violent, Civil Disobedience=94  w/Ruckus Society,
"World Cafe" with The Institute for Noetic Sciences,
"Anti-Military Recruitment" with Not in Our Name,
=94Reclaim the Commons=94 with Starhawk,
=94Street Theatre: Using Drama to Change our World=94 w/Marin Peace and Jus=
tice
Coalition
"The Return of Hayehwatha - A New Understanding of Peace on Earth" with
Andree Morgana of The Hayehwatha Institute
=94Putting the Being Back Into the Human=94 with Phillip Scott, Ancestral V=
oice
Anusara Yoga with Guided by Grace,
The Beehive Collective plus more TBA

Art installations by Bay-Area artist dalabil and the Visual
Consciousness in collaboration with A. Roberts of Guerrilla Gallery

Renewable energy demos including solar-powered stage provided by Solar
Depot, bio-diesel VW Jetta (GCC) and bio-diesel generator powered stage.

The Living Peace Village with healing arts, tasty natural foods,
fair-trade products, arts and crafts, networking, voter registration and
presentations by peace and justice organizations local, national and
global.

Come and express your peace!
This is a benefit fundraiser for the Indigenous Elders and Youth Peace
Gathering
Contact Us. Get Involved!
For more info, directions and ticketing information go to
www.peacegathering.com or call 1-877-576-5861


$18 for Advanced Tickets
$22 at the door
$10 for Seniors and Youth (13 - 17)

Tickets available now online at http://peacegathering.inhousetickets.com
or by phone at 1-866-384-3060
Tickets outlets include: Skills DJ Workshop in Berkeley, Distractions and C=
eiba on Haight St. in SF, and Maximum Music in San Rafael. Please visit our=
 ticketing web-page for more ticket outlets.

Donations can be made out to "Native American Church, Oregon Chapter" and
sent to 1332 Addison St. Berkeley, CA 94702.

Directions: Hwy. 101 to Novato, Take the Atherton/San Marin Drive Exit
(Novato) and turn West onto San Marin Drive. Follow to Novato Blvd (2.5
miles). Turn right onto Novato Blvd. The entrance to Stafford Lake Park
and the Promise for Peace Interactive Peace Festival is 1.5 miles on your
left (passed the Stafford Lake Dam).

Sunday, May 30, 2004 ** echo beach summer monthly **

Starting Sunday May 30th, DJs Garth and Jeno, two of San Francisco's most
respected djs formerly of Wicked, explore a new musical direction with
their new mothly poolside party, Echo Beach, at the Bambuddha Lounge.

Pulling from their extensive collections of underground disco, new wave, ro=
ck,
soul, jazz and reggae, Garth and Jeno bring the heads out for a soul-soothi=
ng
musical backdrop around the Phoenix Hotel's muraled pool.

"We've always been known for throwing in some old disco, funk, new
wave, dubby trippiness or other unorthodox musical inspiration while we
spin," Jen=F6 says. "This party is an opportunity to pursue those other
possibilities with more fervor as we will be expressing ourselves outside
the accepted and usually quite safe musical formats of the current SF club
scene."

Event Date: May 30 2004 and every last sunday of the month all summer

Event Name: Echo Beach

Venue: Bambuddha Lounge; 601 Eddy Street (at Larkin), San Francisco, CA;
415-885-5088;

DJ's: Garth and Jeno (formerly of Wicked)

Musical Style: ECLECTIC - mix of underground disco, new wave, rock, soul, r=
eggae and
melodic house

Cover: NO COVER

Outdoor BBQ provided by Bambuddha's Rising Star Chef Joe Bosworth

www.djjeno.com/echobeach.html

odskitchen and Gatecrasher have helped to elevate Marco=92s popularity and =
his releases are now awaited as eagerly as those of the world=92s most cele=

Saturday, June 12, 2004 ** Loveworks presents: Love Injection **

Loveworks, the spark that has grown into an intense eight year inferno comb=
ining house music, art, and cutting edge atmospherics continues it=92s seri=
es of monthly audiosocial experiments and gives San Francisco a =91 LOVE IN=
JECTION =91 on Saturday June 12th =9204 at their homebase=97 the 111 Minna =
Gallery in San Francisco=92s SOMA District.  This special event will be a c=
ollaboration with SF based deep house music label LOVESLAP and features spe=
cial guest DJ's MAURICIO AVILES & CHARLES SPENCER from the label itself ( s=
ee BIOS below ! ).  Also supporting the guests is Loveworks resident dj DAV=
ID HARNESS, who is also an artist on Loveslap=92s roster; mmm=85 all the be=
tter to groove you with !  At the door will our guardian RAUL celebrating h=
is 40th birthday as well as guest services by the nicest man in security, B=
IG DAVE.  Your hosts for the evening are the inimitable NORI CASTILLO and D=
IANNA JACOBS who were instrumental in the creation of the legendary TOONTOW=
N parties as well as CAREFREE DANCING, the original house party at 177 Town=
send.   Your other hosts for the evening are TALY, JIM & NIKITA.  Also in t=
he early part of the evening, The Loveworks Classics Caf=E9 kicks off the n=
ight properly at 8pm with a special Classics Caf=E9 event starring Haight s=
treet=92s excellent Rooky=92s Records crew; featuring Rooky and DJ Goldmyne=
 spinning and selling fabulous 60's & 70's soul.  Vintage rug-cutting- come=
 "Butter your Popcorn" and "Shake your Moneymaker."  Dig it ?

Bio: MAURICIO AVILES
Born in the capitol of El Salvador in 1969, Mauricio Aviles immigrated with=
 his parents to San Francisco, California in 1973. Growing up in the Missio=
n District, he was constantly surrounded by the latin rhythms of the barrio=
=2E His father had a company that produced theatrical and musical events th=
at featured 'la cultura latina', and eventually Mauricio became involved wi=
th his father's creative enterprise, helping to produce several festivals a=
nd concerts in the Bay Area. The people and the music of this period provid=
ed the foundation for Mauricio's involvement in the City's burgeoning dance=
 scene that evolved throughout the 90's.
As a dj Mauricio's first actual gigs began at the City's bastion of undergr=
ound vibration, the EndUp. As a protege of Arron Olivares, Mauricio began f=
orming his own sounds and creating a devoted following that are still with =
him today. His next regular residencies were simultaneously Corazon, a lati=
n flavored weekly in the heart of the Mission District, and Metrojazz a ver=
y popular and original weekend event that successfully combined down tempo,=
 abstract beats and house, a hybrid that would eventually become to describ=
e the 'San Francisco Sound'.   Acknowledging the urban, afro origins of dan=
ce music, with a personal blend of his own latino roots, and a constant end=
eavor to break new ground, Mauricio's sound is hauntingly personal, emotion=
al and consistently fresh. Creating a niche within the deep house sound, hi=
s style, though ethereal, is undeniably funky and always elicits a great re=
sponse on the dance floor.  Now with an internationally successful compilat=
ion under his belt (Naked Music's Nude Dimension II), Mauricio has begun hi=
s production career with a debut single slated for release in Summer 2001. =
As an emissary for Naked Music, Mauricio has also commenced a global tour, =
ensuring that America's hottest new dance label is well represented.  Mauri=
cio has of late done production work and dj=92d under the moniker of MOVIDO=
, his project with collaborator and Loveslap label founder Charles Spencer.

Bio: DAVID HARNESS
In 1990, David began DJ'ing in his hometown of Monterey, California, at the=
 After Dark. As his popularity grew past the boundaries of Monterey, he was=
 invited to establish a residency at Tilt, and Sound Factory, in San Franci=
sco. In 1992, as David's popularity continued to grow he, along with DJ, Ru=
ben Mancias and promoter Joseph Solis opened a hip and popular club, Lift, =
at Club Dv8. David joined Bay Area legendary DJ, Pete Avila and host Foxxee=
 Brown on 'Your Mama's House', on the Bay Area's popular radio station KMEL=
 FM. Being the only "true" house mix show on any Northern California radio =
station, DJ's David Harness, Pete Avila and host Foxxee Brown have played a=
 key role in furthering House Music in the Bay Area. Also during that year,=
 David established a residency at San Francisco's legendary Club Universe. =
David Harness has quickly become one of the most well known and popular DJ'=
s in the San Francisco Bay Area club scene. David's popularity continued to=
 soar, taking him around the world; and the opportunity to play with New Yo=
rk's Legendary DJ's, Frankie Knuckles, Tony Humphries, Little Louie Vega, T=
edd Patterson, Dave Morales, London's Ricky Morrison, Danny Teneglia, Marqu=
es Wyatt- to name a few. He has appeared in articles and interviews in Bill=
board Magazine, Paper Magazine, Surface, XLR8R, Urb, Streetsounds, Sweater,=
 HX, Next and the Bay Guardian.



Bio: LOVEWORKS
Add a large helping of deep underground house music with a side of funk, a =
heap of disco, and a hint of techno, and you have the most nutritious dance=
floor experience available in San Francisco. Initially conceived by Dianna =
Jacobs and Nori Castillo of Toontown /  Carefree fame in the summer of '96,=
 Loveworks was envisioned as a refuge from the monotony of local clubs and =
superficial music, and  has become one of the bay area's most well known ni=
ghts out, while somehow remaining one it's best kept secrets.  It exists to=
 unite people of any race, social status or sexuality together in a comfort=
able and friendly club environment with music as the focal point, and in ad=
dition to it's monthly parties at the Minna Gallery, Loveworks also teams u=
p with other like minded parties around the city and has been featured at c=
lubs and parties such as Liquid, the Top, Electric, and the Endup.  Besides=
 late night dancing, Loveworks has also been involved in events for Wired M=
agazine, Apple Computer, Sony Digital, Construct Internet Design, and a hos=
t of others. Loveworks also had the honor of winning the SF Bay Guardian=92=
s =91 BEST HOUSE CLUB =91 in 1999.


Bio: 111 MINNA GALLERY
111 Minna Gallery is a dynamic =91contemporary art salon=92 that provides a=
n arena for multi-dimensional artistic expression in a community atmosphere=
=2E The goal of the =91gallery-as salon=92 concept is to nurture and suppor=
t a communal gathering of artists and a collaboration between diverse art f=
orms. This goal is achieved through six-week rotations of visual art exhibi=
tions curated by the staff combined with a variety of music and film events=
=2E =91Minna=92 is not only the name of the street on which the gallery is =
found but also translates from Japanese as "everybody," an all-inclusive te=
rm that symbolizes the embracing environment of the space. The gallery, whi=
ch also offers two bars, is crafted in an eclectic, contemporary design wit=
h ample furniture inviting guests to leisurely relax and enjoy conversation=
 among friends. The combination of art, music, film, dance and conversation=
 found at 111 Minna Gallery creates a unique gathering place for a multi-se=
nsory experience.


( contact: Nori for information and guest list questions / 866 841 9139 ext=
 2016 / loveworksdancing@onebox.com )

Thursday, June 24, 2004 ** Fuzion Presents 100% Tony Humphries, A Bay Area =
Exclusive **

House music has evolved from the soulful, gospel-inspired sounds of disco, =
and it owes its emergence to the artistry of DJ Tony Humphries. His unmista=
kable style continues to leave an irreplaceable impression on the global da=
nce music industry having entertained at over 500 venues worldwide and prod=
ucing more than 200 studio remixes. Throughout tremendous recognition, nume=
rous awards and accolades from his peers, Tony Humphries has remained humbl=
e and true to the sound of what we call house music.

Please join us for this special one night engagement, with Djs Tony Humphri=
es, David Harness, Matt Mau and Bernard Cabigon. At =93Mighty=94 Located in=
 the heart of the SF design district, within blocks of both Hwy 101 and Hwy=
 280, Mighty boasts a 6,000 square foot expanse of beautiful hardwood floor=
s, 22=88 high ceilings, exposed brick walls, and gigantic wood pillars and =
beams throughout. Sound system comes to Mighty from the legendary Sound Fac=
tory in New York City. It is a classic Richard Long & Associates system wit=
h most of the original components lovingly restored for the venue.

Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

Subject: [sfraves] I got my Groovy on @ Mash Up!!!

OK... so last night was soooooo fuckin' Dope.. Hello 2Day.. Oh MY Goodness man.. I has so much fun!!  I mean.. OK.. well.. except 4 like this moment where I was like skipping 2 the dance floor & accidentally tripped over some1's foot & like totally fell down & like while tryin' 2 break my fall, I like extended my right arm & the impact wwas like sooooooo mondo WHOA that I totall flipped myself around & was laughin while lying down on the ground by the bar.. LoL.. it was funny as fuckin' hell what happened ya know.. but damn... my arm is like totally mondo sprained right now & hurts like fuck... LoL... I'dalmost say that it was worth it 'cause the party was so Dope! =)

Ya know.. if i had 2 pick a set that i enjoyed the most.. I can't... aaaaaaaaaall the DJs fuckin' rocked the house!

I did like how the tag set between Ban & Nick Nyuquil was like well.. U could like mondo tell that there were 2 diff DJs spinning from the tracks they spun... that was pretty sick!  I even loved Atena & Aaron J 'cause like same thing... Athena spins really dark breakbeats and aaron J was like all about future i guess...  It was fun hangin out w/ wish & odeed when they were @ the party.. their set was pretty fuckin' Dope!! also!!  I wasn't sure what were OG tracks they spun & produced... but man... YUMYUMYUM!!!

Majere spun a Groovy set... LoL.. he did start out spinning Brakbeats, LoL... yeah... we all pretty much had a feeling that he was gonna be spinning some kinda trance in there somewhere which was so fun!!  I mean... he kinda spun like tancey breakbeats!!  I Loved ADubl's set... it was totally proper..  OK.. who else am i 4getting who spun??? hmmmmm

The crowd there was totally diverse.. I mean... like seriously.. there were soooooo much mixed energies @ the party that it was neato!!  But there was a strong Family pressence there... LoL... Loved it!!!  LoL... yeah!! LMAO The Holy Trinity... anywaze... LoL... I talked w/ my friend Heather alot that night about aloooooooota things, as well as Andy, gosh... every1... LoL... some girl heard me say Hello 2day & she was alll "Hello 2morow, Hello Nextweek, Hello Next Month, Hello Next year... LoL.. it was heeeeeeeeeella funny...

The venue was sooo Groovy!  Oh My Goodness man... I was in Hevean & the whole night I kept sing "My Looooooooovin' no youre never gonna get it" & the decorations were like totally Awesome man!  I mean.. somewhat minimal, a few banners here & there, lighting.. OK.. YUM...   Seriously.. the main room  looked all space agey! LoL


All in all.. i had the best fuckn' time @ this party!!  Hello 2Day.. so much fun!!  I mean.. regardless of the arm injury, i still managed 2 dance!!  LoL.. I can't wait 2 C all the pictures from that night.. 

LoL  fun Stuff...

(she rocks!).

https://www.groovetickets.com/ordersystem/groove/eventviewqb.asp?AffilID=93&
EventsID=10285&PGname=Squid%2Ecom

Maybe that URL will work for you, otherwise:

https://www.groovetickets.com/ -- search for ENGAGE (and I've linked the
HTTPS site since it's so much faster than the normal HTTP site).

Friday, July 16th 2004
@ Kelly's Mission Rock in San Francisco
This is an 18+ event

This will be an event to remember.  Four crews come together under the same
roof for a single night to impress everyone.

* Four areas of music
* 100% Fully permitted venue
* Two bars for the 21+
* Indoor and Outdoor settings
* Plenty of parking

Subject: [sfraves] SRR: MIXER REPAIR???

I have a Numark that has kept me spinning for the last month or so, but a 
friend of mine is donating me his old Pioneer DJM 500, which needs a few 
repairs. Does anyone know of a reputable shop that can get it up and running 
again for a decentr price? Or are any of you folks out in SFR land 
electronically inclined enough to do this sort of thing???

Basic rundown of problems:

Channel 1: volume is insanely low even w/ gain or volume up all the way.
Channel 2: up fader is broken off - I'm assuming he means the little metal 
slider-bit, not the actual fader inside the mixer.
Channel 3: unless you hold fader down it bleeds, also the bass cuts in and 
out
Channel 4: has similar bass knob problem, but that's about it.

The (bass) knob issues could just be dirty pots - that's what it sounds like 
to me, and I know the Pioneers are infamous for having dirty pot issues.. 
The real concerns are mainly with Channel 1 and 2. My friend got a quote for 
about $130 worth of repairs, but that was from a guy who does repairs at his 
house, not at a shop. Anyway....any help will be greatly appreciated!

Marc(O)
*THWAP!*//Substructure//Mario Bros.
DC/MD/VA/CA
deep.funky.techy.tribal.progressive.nuskool.beats&bass
AIM:  OPKing138

Subject: [sfraves] Alumni review: Burning down the house

Alumni burned it down Saturday night. Full on raging crazy rave
madness. I was totally sober and could *not* stop dancing all
night :).

As advertised, it was all about the old stuff. And what really
got me, all night, was realizing just how *good* a lot of those
tracks really were. Yeah :).

Downstairs, watching Markie Mark mix... I'm just in awe of
how good he is. Dude takes mixing to a whole new level. If I
weren't so busy dancing, I could just watch him mix all day.

My favorite moment of the night was watching Spun take over with
"Dance with the speaker". Everyone went completely ballistic :).

Upstairs, the FnF crew also rocked like hell, had the floor
packed in with dancers all night. ALL of the DJs did outstanding
jobs.

I was tired and all danced out, and had that happy glow. My
feet were sore. My butt was sore. I was thinking of bouncing
over to Woom for some quality ambient sit-down time. Mmmmmmm
fuzzy here I come.

Then John Carel hit the decks.

John baby, you are the fucking man. That set was brilliant. It
got my sorry ass up and yelling. It got everybody yelling. The
whole time. Aw dude. You better put an armed guard on that crate.

And don't even consider another sabbatical. You either play
out or we're going over to your house.

Sean

Dance with the speaker till you hear it blow
B-b-b blow blow

I kept forgetting I was at the DNA Lounge and not at a normal party =
space. The place went off like I couldn't believe. FnF did a great job =
switching things up decorations wise and it was a mini-family party up =
there. So many faces that I hadn't seen in a while. SO MUCH MUSIC that I =
hadn't heard in even longer! Patrice in a fuzzy hat and candy. Classic. =
Me running home and grabbing my old 1999//2000 raver gear and reviving =
*candy ryan* for the night. I had an amazing time at that party and =
couldn't believe how many people came and how many people were still =
there at 5am. Most parties these days look pretty empty at 5am. Not =
Alumni! The main room and upstairs both were still going strong.

I can't help but feel like I had a time warp back to 1999 when people =
were really into partying and that excitement of something new was all =
around you. That was the highlight of my weekend.

five.dollah.made.me.hollah

:: r ::

Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="=====================_12736063==.ALT"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Checking in on the godfathers of San Francisco's electronic DJ
  scene 

--=====================_12736063==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

MUSIC

In Deep With House

Checking in on the godfathers of San Francisco's electronic DJ scene

<mailto:chronfeedback@sfchronicle.com>STEVE SANDE, San Francisco Chronicle, 
May 23, 2004

"Not everyone understands house music. It's a spiritual thing, a body 
thing, a soul thing." -- Eddie Amador, "House Music".

Humans love to dance. I'm sure if Cro-Magnon man had stumbled across a few 
peyote buttons, stretched a piece of wooly mammoth hide across a hollowed- 
out log, picked up a stick and banged, he would have been dancing around 
the fire like a crazed banshee. What else would there be to do on a weekend 
night in a dark, cold cave in France?

Modern Homo sapiens congregate on weekend nights in dark, sweaty 
nightclubs, dancing, perhaps chanting, and ingesting God-knows-what 
inebriants, in a tribal ritual that spans the eons. The music that makes 
today's kids boogie like their early ancestors is called house. It's a form 
of electronic music -- manufactured mostly on machines and computers -- 
that's rhythmic, bass heavy, infectious and downright groovy (see sidebar, 
page 27).

These days, some of the best electronic music in the world is produced 
right here. The Bay Area is home to three pioneers -- Jay-J, Chris Smith 
and Garth. All three fell in love with the city, saw a burgeoning music 
scene in the early '90s and hit the dance floor with a purpose. Responsible 
for some of the earliest (and best) dance records of the '90s , and many of 
the most memorable parties of that time, Jay-J, Smith and Garth have 
contributed mightily to the San Francisco dance music scene. All three have 
endured the ups and downs of a highly competitive music business, as well 
as Sept. 11's negative effect on nightlife, while flying under the radar of 
mainstream commercial music. Their stories inspire with a do-it-yourself 
attitude and a truth that reflect the city's underground roots.

Article continued at:

http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=/chronicle/archive/2004/05/23/CMGON6BD4F1.DTL 




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

SOMA Sessions is San Francisco's premier weekend
Jungle/Drum 'n Bass party.  On every Fourth Friday we
invite leading hand-picked DJ talents from around the
globe to play extended sets in an intimate setting
which forms the idea of the "session."  Don't miss our
fifth episode this Friday featuring roots Drum 'n
Bass! 


Friday May 28, 2004

++ OLD SKOOL JUNGLE NIGHT ++

Subject: [sfraves] (NRR) More veiled hints at military draft from Senator Clinton

	Someone had questioned why I mentioned Hilary Clinton along with 
George Bush and Donald Rumsfeld in a recent message...

				<<< Starchild >>>


Sens. Clinton, Graham call for larger U.S. military
Former political foes strike an alliance
Monday, May 24, 2004 Posted: 8:10 AM EDT (1210 GMT)

Democrat Hillary Rodham Clinton and Republican Lindsey Graham agree the
U.S. needs a larger military.

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- An unlikely pair of Senate allies called for a
larger military Sunday and pledged a thorough investigation of abuse
against Iraqi prisoners in Baghdad.

Sens. Hillary Rodham Clinton, D-New York, and Lindsey Graham, R-South
Carolina, are both members of the Senate's Armed Services Committee.

"A number of us have been sounding this alarm. We have to face the fact
we need a larger active-duty military," Clinton told the television show
"Fox News Sunday."

"We cannot continue to stretch our troops, both active-duty, Guard and
Reserve, to the breaking point, which is what we're doing now."

Graham said the United States is "putting too much pressure on the men
and women in uniform."

"We need more of them, sooner rather than later," he said.

The senators acknowledged that an increase in the size of the military
would be an expensive venture...

element <element@modifiedproductions.com> wrote:
FRIDAY MAY 28, 2004
__________________
modified productions presents:
-+SUBHOTEL+-

dragnfly [shaolin productions/audio metamorphosis] playing dark tech-induced
trance
element [modified] playing progressive house/breaks
thomas kent [modified/ill behavior] playing trancegressive techno
wavelength [oneiromancy] playing hard/acid trance
emune vs the doctor [ill behavior] vs [LVDJ's/bayraves.com] playing dnb
hyjinx [thought crime/rawheaven] spinning progressive breaks

11pm-5am
local *virgin* indoor ug location
sound by modified

########IMPORTANT INFORMATION########
tickets available day of only
$3 at the map point, and $10 at the door.
the pricing is set to encourage people to go to the map point, and NOT just
show up at the location.
the map point will open at 11pm and promptly close at 2am, so please plan
accordingly!
PLEASE HELP US PARTY ALL NITE: no ins and outs. no cell phones. no
guestlist. no flyering.
infoline: 510.272.0297
########IMPORTANT INFORMATION########

element@modifedproductions.com
thomaskent@modifiedproductions.com
event info, mixes and more: http://www.modifiedproductions.com

Hi, I love Modified's parties and am looking forward to this one. I saw the  
"no cell phone" thing too, and I'm just wondering what the reasons would be 
for  this. Is it so people can't call their friends saying, "Wow, you've got to 
get  over to this bangin' party!" and then it gets too crowded? 
Or is it so people can't bypass the map point?  There is already a  much 
lower price at the map point than at the door, so people will go to the map  point 
instead of directly to the venue. 
If people have to walk back to their cars to put away their phones, that  
will increase the noticibility of the venue. If there is a shuttle involved,  
people will just say "screw it" and leave. There might be good reasons for this,  
but I don't think it will work.  
?

-------------------------------1085506758--

blah, blah, blah.

ryan,

correct me if im wrong - but have you actually been to one of our parties?
other then what you *might* have heard via the grapevine or a messageboard
here and there, you really have no idea about how modified operates, or the
crowds we are attracting.  sure, the rule may *seem* stupid - but there's a
good reason behind it.  perhaps if you got up off your insanely jaded ass,
and took a minute to talk to the promoters behind the show and really see
what's up, you might see where we are coming from and show some respect.
maybe not...but at least you would be informed about your ranting and
ravings and perhaps could provide some useful critiquing.  oh wait...it's
much more fun to just talk shit, cause talking shit is definitely what makes
the scene better!

our crowd is great, and at past events we have asked people to follow
similar "out of the ordinary" guidelines.  i am confident that once we speak
to them and explain why we are asking what we are - they will, as usual,
understand.  sure, some of them might not care, but most will continue to
respect what we ask.

element
modifedproductions.com

From: Nathan Osburn <tappy_tibbons@sbcglobal.net>

In-Reply-To: <4f.3eb66679.2de4dec6@aol.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0

Subject: Re: [sfraves] [modified] -+submotel+- THIS friday 5.28 $3 virgin location

--0-813220316-1085507352=:64285
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

I saw this reason that element had posted on another forum, and i do agree, it makes pretty good sence. I dont think it will be to successfull, cause i mean who's gonna get rid of ther cell phone... but shit, people should respect the promoters requests. i know i wont be calling anyone with info once it reaches capacity.
 
"we had people continue to show up at our last show, even after we changed the info line begging people not to come, as our parking area was full. we also stopped the music and asked the crowd not to call their friends, as we had reached capacity. people seemed to have a hard time listening, and heads continued to poor in, putting a huge amount of stress on us as promoters to be able to run things as smoothly as we needed to hold a successful event. 

its not that we hate cell phones, or lots of people showing up to our events. we just need people to look beyond partying like a rockstar - just for a second - and listen to what we need you to do to make the event successful. last time around, that didnt happen so we are asking everyone to leave their cell phones at home or in their vehicles. staff will have multiple cell phones freely available should anyone need to make an urgent call. no one will have any trouble finding the venue or getting in if they follow the directions. 

venues often get burned and promoters in trouble because people fail to respect not only the spaces, but also the guidelines promoters have set out. if people can respect those guidelines then events are less likely to get shutdown, venues less likely to get burned and promoters in less trouble. the result? more parties and better parties for everyone involved. 

<imho> 
i believe a new age of partying is among us - its all about the responsible partier. venues are much more scarce then they used to be, and times are more difficult for promoters. no longer can one show up at a giant warehouse and expect to do whatever they want with no regard to themselves, their friends, promoters or our neighbors. respect yourself and respect those around you, and perhaps we can all be part of something great. 
</imho> 

[element]"

JonnyR@aol.com wrote:
Hi, I love Modified's parties and am looking forward to this one. I saw the 
"no cell phone" thing too, and I'm just wondering what the reasons would be 
for this. Is it so people can't call their friends saying, "Wow, you've got to 
get over to this bangin' party!" and then it gets too crowded? 
Or is it so people can't bypass the map point? There is already a much 
lower price at the map point than at the door, so people will go to the map point 
instead of directly to the venue. 
If people have to walk back to their cars to put away their phones, that 
will increase the noticibility of the venue. If there is a shuttle involved, 
people will just say "screw it" and leave. There might be good reasons for this, 
but I don't think it will work. 
?

--0-813220316-1085507352=:64285--

Subject: RE: [sfraves] [modified] -+submotel+- THIS friday 5.28 $3 virgin location

Hi, I love Modified's parties and am looking forward to this one. I saw the
"no cell phone" thing too, and I'm just wondering what the reasons would be
for this. Is it so people can't call their friends saying, "Wow, you've got
to get over to this bangin' party!" and then it gets too crowded?
##################
yes - we had people continue to show up at our last show, even after we
changed the info line begging people not to come, as our parking area filled
by 1am. we also stopped the music and asked the crowd not to call their
friends, as we had reached capacity. people seemed to have a hard time
listening, and heads continued to poor in, putting a huge amount of stress
on us as promoters to be able to run things as smoothly as we needed to hold
a successful event.
##################

Or is it so people can't bypass the map point?  There is already a much
lower price at the map point than at the door, so people will go to the map
point instead of directly to the venue.
##################
yes - this is yet another attempt to drive people to the map point and not
just show up.  we spend time to meet people, talk to them and let them know
what we need from them at the map point so that they have the best possible
party experience.
##################

If people have to walk back to their cars to put away their phones, that
will increase the noticibility of the venue. If there is a shuttle involved,
people will just say "screw it" and leave. There might be good reasons for
this, but I don't think it will work.
##################
i hate shuttles too.  modified makes it a point to be sure our events dont
make use of shuttles. we will not be shuttling friday nite.
##################

element
modifedproductions.com

What I got from the previous email was that they did
not want people to circumvent the map point and then
rush the door. But wouldn't it just be better to have
a limited number of maps and no door availability?
That way the staff could turn people away at the map
point.  It sucks to get locked out, but the early bird
does get the worm.

Besides, are they going to search people? I don't like
that kind of vibe at parties. You might as well be the
security at 1015.  Limit access, not the party goer's
possessions. 

 My $.02...

arise.  there will also be signs at the water bar, door and dj booth asking
those who insist on bringing their phone in to not use it. There will also
be posted instructions on how to find someone with a phone at the party for
those that are willing to help us.

-----Original Message-----
From: element [mailto:element@modifiedproductions.com]
Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 2004 10:54 AM
To: JonnyR@aol.com; sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: RE: [sfraves] [modified] -+submotel+- THIS friday 5.28 $3
virgin location


Hi, I love Modified's parties and am looking forward to this one. I saw the
"no cell phone" thing too, and I'm just wondering what the reasons would be
for this. Is it so people can't call their friends saying, "Wow, you've got
to get over to this bangin' party!" and then it gets too crowded?
##################
yes - we had people continue to show up at our last show, even after we
changed the info line begging people not to come, as our parking area filled
by 1am. we also stopped the music and asked the crowd not to call their
friends, as we had reached capacity. people seemed to have a hard time
listening, and heads continued to poor in, putting a huge amount of stress
on us as promoters to be able to run things as smoothly as we needed to hold
a successful event.
##################

Or is it so people can't bypass the map point?  There is already a much
lower price at the map point than at the door, so people will go to the map
point instead of directly to the venue.
##################
yes - this is yet another attempt to drive people to the map point and not
just show up.  we spend time to meet people, talk to them and let them know
what we need from them at the map point so that they have the best possible
party experience.
##################

If people have to walk back to their cars to put away their phones, that
will increase the noticibility of the venue. If there is a shuttle involved,
people will just say "screw it" and leave. There might be good reasons for
this, but I don't think it will work.
##################
i hate shuttles too.  modified makes it a point to be sure our events dont
make use of shuttles. we will not be shuttling friday nite.
##################

element
modifedproductions.com

possessions.

Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="=====================_11601331==.ALT"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves] $3/map point & cell phone issue.

--=====================_11601331==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

At 11:32 AM 5/25/2004, Brian Lafferty wrote:

>What I got from the previous email was that they did
>not want people to circumvent the map point and then
>rush the door. But wouldn't it just be better to have
>a limited number of maps and no door availability?
>That way the staff could turn people away at the map
>point.  It sucks to get locked out, but the early bird
>does get the worm.

I infer from the discussion that element wishes to avoid a situation that 
all of us who still use map points have experienced:  once folks get the 
address at the map point they call their friends, who call their friends, 
and everyone bypasses the map point and goes directly to the venue.  At our 
last event nearly fifty percent of the guests went directly to the 
venue.  We use a map point to provide an additional layer of security for 
the venue at an underground.  The actual address is less likely to fall 
into unfriendly hands, and we avoid lines of people standing outside 
without tickets hoping to get in.  Next time we do a party we will give 
direction slips to all ticket holders at the mp and require all guests to 
show the map point directions at the door or they won't get in.

However, there must be some other reason for a cell phone ban at the 
venue.  Banning cell phones inside is not going to eliminate the problem of 
having people phone the venue location to their friends from the car.  Who 
knows?


>Besides, are they going to search people? I don't like
>that kind of vibe at parties. You might as well be the
>security at 1015.  Limit access, not the party goer's
>possessions.

As I have said before, I now refuse to go to any party, club or otherwise, 
where I will be searched in any fashion.  I struggle with this because I'm 
missing lots of good music but that's where I've decided to take a 
stand.  Just can't deal with pat downs and the like.

Love,

Apollo



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Looking for something fun and relaxing to do this weekend? Wanna go out and
enjoy the holiday, but sick of the predictable club experiences on offer?

Echo beach - Memorial Day Weekend Sunday - NO COVER!

DJs Garth and Jeno, two of San  Francisco's most
respected djs rise from the ashes of Wicked's 13
year reign of glory to begin a new musical adventure
at the indoor/outdoor club/restaurant - Bambuddha
Lounge.

Pulling from their extensive collections of underground disco,
new wave, rock, soul, jazz and reggae, Garth and Jeno bring the
heads out for a unique, experimental & soul warming musical
adventure around the Phoenix Hotel's muraled pool. "We've
always been known for throwing in some old disco, funk, new
wave, dubby trippiness or other unorthodox musical
inspiration while we spin," Jenö says. "This party is an
opportunity to pursue those other possibilities with more fervor
as we will be expressing ourselves outside the accepted and
usually quite safe musical formats of the current SF club
scene." So, expect the unexpected...!


Also enjoy the outdoor BBQ provided by Bambuddha's Rising Star Chef Joe
Bosworth.

There will be NO COVER for this all ages Sunday afternoon soiree, and we 
will be open all afternoon and evening from 2 until 10pm.

Bambuddha Lounge is located @ 601 Eddy Street (at Larkin), San
Francisco, CA; 415-885-5088

For more info go to 
-  <http://www.djjeno.com/echobeach.html>http://www.djjeno.com/echobeach.html

Subject: Re: [sfraves] [modified] -+submotel+- THIS friday 5.28 $3 virgin location

> That just bullshit because they can't think of another way to
> manage their party. Amateurs.

Precisely why I got on the kid's ass about no cellphones. Causes more
problems and solves nothing. Especially when you figure that most people
will hear about the party as word of mouth and never see a BSP stating that
they can't have a cellphone. All of a sudden you have people showing up at
the party that are finding out they can't have their cellphone with them.
That's going to cause drama at the door. Drama is going to mean more
attention drawn to the party. Pissing people off that are coming to your
party potentially results in a vengeful call to the police and the end of
your event.

If I wanted to be hardcore about people not calling friends it would be
easy. Shuttle people in a van with blacked out windows. Drive a route that
is longer, has more turns than needed, but thoroughly confuses the
passengers. When they arrive, and if it's a place that no one has been to,
most likely they won't have a clue as to where they are and thus calling
friends does them no good.

The fact is that there is no real solid answer to the problem of people
revealing a party location. Well, there is one. You only invite people that
you know are mindful of the type of event they're going to. From what it
sounds like this event caters to a bunch of people that have no clue how to
act in a renegade//ug environment. This is why selective promoting is great
and part of that includes not posting to SFR, F8, BayRaves, DJ-D list,
etc... =)

:: r ::


---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org


From sfraves-return-112803-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Tue May 25 21:28:08 2004
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-112803-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 97572 invoked by uid 1103); 25 May 2004 21:28:08 -0000

Message-Id: <6.1.0.6.2.20040525140537.02447500@localhost>
X-Sender: apollo@localhost
X-Mailer: QUALCOMM Windows Eudora Version 6.1.0.6
Date: Tue, 25 May 2004 14:28:05 -0700
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>

In-Reply-To: <340D5A031E64C2468AF37960805A374506E26B@us1-mail16.pcle.com

Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="=====================_15791306==.ALT"
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves] $3/map point & cell phone issue.

--=====================_15791306==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

At 01:37 PM 5/25/2004, Steve Osteen wrote:
>  "Just can't deal with pat downs and the like."
>
>Love,
>Apollo
>
>
>Just curious, but why do you feel that way?
>
>Sadly, I don't think we're too far away from a time where suicide bombers 
>enter a busy club and blow the whole place up. I would rather everyone get 
>a small pat down, hell, maybe security should just be a big giant hug to 
>each person entering.

Prior to the late nineties one could go any club or event, produce an ID at 
the door, often get a hug and smile from the door person, and go inside 
feeling like an honored guest and not some potential criminal.  Ins and 
outs were the rule and, again, one didn't have to go into another line for 
pat downs to get back in.  My vibe was intact when I went in the door.  I 
felt welcome.

I am told by many club owners that the current invasive system is designed 
to comply with anti-drug efforts at clubs and the like.  Well, as any drug 
entrepreneur knows, unless one were to initiate strip and cavity searches 
on the street these pat downs become symbolic gestures to placate the 
police.  Seems to me that the requirement for enforcement of what many 
believe unenforceable drug prohibitions have fallen on the venue owners and 
promoters and we are all suffering from these feeble and personally 
humiliating attempts to control the uncontrollable.  The war on drugs is a 
dismal failure and has morphed into a war on American citizens.

This club security situation is, to me, a microcosm of the fearful trend in 
our society to sacrifice freedom for security.  Those who agree to this end 
up with neither.  I've had security people go into my wallet;  confiscate 
open packs of cigarettes;  take boxes of mints; require me to empty the 
many pockets in my cargo pants in full view of other patrons.  After these 
assaults on my privacy and theft of my personal property I became 
increasingly unhappy and angry and decided I would no longer consent to 
violations of personal freedoms.  Shit, by the time I went through all this 
my attitude was dark and aggressive.  My partner is even worse.

As for worries about terrorist bombings, well, freedom involves risk, often 
great risk.  I would rather have freedom than some false assurance of 
safety.  If some terrorist wants to find a way to blow me into that great 
dancefloor in the sky no thug security person is going to prevent that.

I have gone to selected hip hop events where it is assumed some guests 
might be packing.  At these events they have unintrusive metal 
detectors.  No stranger runs their hands up and down your legs and 
ass.  Hot or not, I don't really appreciate that kind of personal attention:)

Love,

Apollo




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"The welfare of the people in particular has always been the alibi of 
tyrants, and it provides the further advantage of giving the servants of 
tyranny a good conscience."
-Albert Camus

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

"I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

--=====================_15791306==.ALT--

your ass.  I thought that was what the underground was
all about, existing in that space where the control
mechanisms of our current society do not operate. I
believe, we cannnot let the system enlist our
promoters as their agents.

I dont beleive they really expected every single person to leave their phone in the car. I think this was more of a way to discourage the use of cell phones. I mean i dont see why its such a big deal. If you want to bring it in im sure your not going to be turned away, as there will be no searches. But it is nice to help out with a promoters request, even if you dont see how it will help anything, its not your party... people at are guests and should behave accordingly. Especially somthing as fragile as a ug party, because people are putting their ass's on the line for your enjoyment, and for 3 bux you know they arent making any money. No need for people to bich about a simple request. Just my opinion... im going to leave my phone in the car.....

From sfraves-return-112808-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Tue May 25 22:12:44 2004
